<Wordwrap>Practe sa! Richtár dnes zakáza.English: <WordWrap>Get lost! The burgmaster forbid anyone from entering the town! The tavern also closes early because of this, don't bother going.\n<Guard>

<Wordwrap>Páni dobrotiví, vidím, že dobr.English: <WordWrap>Good men, I see that you mean well, yet passage I cannot grant. The burgmaster commands that none enters, he fears the Hussites. They set blaze to the old castle! And if it weren't Hussites, then even a fouler band. To the tavern, however, go. At least a pint they will pour, for restful slumber.\n<Guard>

<Wordwrap>Važeni pani, za čože do dediny.English: <WordWrap>Hark, good lords, for what cause hath led thee unto our humble village? \n<Guardsman>

<Wordwrap>Mal by doma byť. Byva v strede.English: He should be at his abode, dwelling midst the heart of yon village. \n<Guardsman>

<Wordwrap>Nervozny už je pes. Pome ho ri.English: <Wordwrap>Dog doth grow restless. Let us return her unto the burgmaster. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Áh, tu ste. Poď Nora, poď k pá.English: Ah, there thou art. Come, Nora, come to thy master. \n<Burgmaster>

<Wordwrap>Banda skončila... a s nimi aj.English: <Wordwrap>The band is vanquished... and with them, a few cultists. Didst thou dispatch those cutthroats from the cult against us? \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Ja? Chlapi, prečo ma z takého.English: I? Why dost thou falsely accuse me, good sirs. \n<Burgmaster>

<Wordwrap>Banda skončila. Lupiči už viac.English: <Wordwrap>The band is defeated. The robbers shall pillage no more, for we hath routed them.

<Wordwrap>Mali by sme Aničke pomôcť, čak.English:
<Wordwrap>We should go help Anička, awaiting by the cliffside, she is.
\n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Ja do koscela nejdzem takto za.English: I shall not go to the church so scantily clad. 'Tis a shame upon shame. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Do katakomby sa bojim isc takt.English: <Wordwrap>I fear to venture into the catacombs so naked. 'Tis cold there, we shall catch a chill before we know it. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Dvaja holoprdi idu do lesa na.English: <Wordwrap>Two simpletons venture into the woods for an outing? 'Tis indeed a rotten idea. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Maceju, isto chceme teraz toty.English:
Matej, dost we truly plan to pursue the priest’s minstrels at this hour?
For anon the darkness doth approach, and we find ourselves in the woods like lost souls. \n

<Wordwrap>Abo še pomodli, možno že sa ci.English: <Wordwrap>Or mayhaps ye shouldst pray, perchance Saint Teresa shall appear and guide us, or some such... Although methinks it bears little sense.\n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Ach. Asi máš pravdu.\n<Wordwra.English:
<Wordwrap>Ah, thou mayst be right. Very well, but on the morrow we must venture forth in search of them. 
\n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Hej, hej. Hlavne už pome. Jutr.English: Aye, aye, let us haste. Tomorrow we shall resolve \^ \n<Pavol>

Počkaj! \\!\n<Wordwrap>Pohľaď! Niekto oh.English:
Halt!\!
Look! Someone hath kindled a fire yonder! \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>To je sprostô toto. Takto sa p.English: This is folly indeed. To reveal themselves thus. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Cicho budzeš? Šak ty ši horši.English: <Wordwrap>Hold ye tongue! Ye art worse than my old woman who ran away. Canst ye not see they are but mere jesters, and the priest is nowhere to be found.\n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Prostred dediny žije Richtár..English: <Wordwrap>The burgmaster dwelleth here, amidst the very core of our village, upon the square. \n<Guardsman>

<Wordwrap>Kec ani richtar neje v bezpeču.English: <Wordwrap>Even the burgmaster art not safe here, and what of us poor souls! They shall descend upon us, they shall rend, they shall slay. \n<Guardsman>

<Wordwrap>Kejc chcece znac šicko ta idzc.English: <Wordwrap>If ye want to know everthing go seek the Jew, in a hut in the woods. But some hath whispered, he lies in league with czechs. Husites or somesuch! Today, 'tis naught but a congregation of misfortune, oh Lord, this youthful generation shall lead us to our graves. \n<Guardsman>

<Wordwrap>Pri rieke husiti vystrajaju! Z.English: <Wordwrap>Hark! By the river, the Hussites linger! They're drowning someone there oncemore. I passed by this morning, a dreadful sight. \n<Guardsman>

<Wordwrap>Takto do koscela nejdem. Rovno.English: <WordWrap>I shall not venture thus to the church. I might as well go stark naked. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Jaj, hnev Boži na nas sadnul!.English: <Wordwrap>Oh, the wrath of the heavens hath descended upon us! And the burgmaster cares naught, not a finger doth he lift. \n<Peasant>

<Wordwrap>Poradky by tu trebalo porobic..English: <Wordwrap>Oh, the wrath of the heavens hath descended upon us! And the burgmaster cares naught, not a finger doth he lift. His excuses abound, God alone knows with what devil's bargain he hath struck! And the Lord himself, spends his days idly playing and gazing upon his mural within his chamber. \n<Cotter>

<Wordwrap>Neznam, co im do hlavy hudli t.English: <Wordwrap>Verily, we need things in order. Half of the children hath fled from us, a strange occurrence indeed. They act as if they were enchanted, aggressive. I lament that for those who seek no guidance, there be none to be given. We doth not know should we band together and set upon cultists wth pitchforks, or what. Yet we doth not seek our children beaten dead. \n<Cotter>

<Wordwrap>Taky ryk divoky sa neška ozyva.English: <Wordwrap>Ferocious roar echoed from the graveyard near the church. God knows whether a wild boar fell there or worse, some monster from the woods. It's not as it used to be, when I was young, I went to the forest and I did not have to worry that I would not come back. \n<Cotter>

<Wordwrap>Parobci moji, čuli sce už o qa.English: <Wordwrap>My lads, have you heard of qahwah? These new beans from the south, 'tis become quite the rage amongst our folk. But I care not for such novelties, a pint suffices for me. Though if ye hath some I might partake 'tis as dark as a moonless night. \n<Villein>

<Wordwrap>Aľe teho Turka, co to furt pij.English: <Wordwrap>Alas that Turk who incessantly imbibes it, I'd send him where the sun don't shine, he's forever spouting strange rhymes. \n<Villein>

<Wordwrap>Ci pana, sce čuli? Vof ľese hu.English:
<Wordwrap>Hath you heard? In the woods, the Hussites swarm like ants.
Last time, they slaughtered each other! But I advise against wandering near the stream, they play holy inquisition there and baptize people by force. Yet, 'tis a sin to be a formatted Catholic, that's what they preached to us in the church. I'd rather drown than be formatted.\n<Guardsman>

<Wordwrap>Tak še zda, že budze padac. A.English: <Wordwrap>It will rain, so it seems, gotta find my cap, lest I want water trickle down my neck.\n<Footman>

Pre Božiu lásku, nezabijajce nas!\\n<Zbr.English: By the grace of God, spare our lives! \n<Warrior>

<Wordwrap>Nesmieme ich nechať ujsť!\\n<M.English: We must not let them to flee! \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Kašlime na nich, Maceju. Šak i.English: <Wordwrap>Let us not concern ourselves with them, Matej. We shall not pursue them through the woods like lunatics. Instead, let us attempt to lure some creature with the bean. Perhaps a duck or a chicken. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Nuž... Predsa ale mali by sme.English: <Wordwrap>Verily... Nonetheless, we should still seek them out. Surely, they still possess knowledge. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Parobci, kam máte tak naponáhl.English: Where so hastily rush ye, lads? The day be still young. \n<Bodyguard>

<Wordwrap>Uhni hovado, to ne tvoja staro.English: <Wordwrap>Step aside, ye fool! 'Tis none of ye concern. Go seek relief to the brothel, and clear the path ere I thrash ye. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Co toto ma byc? To už moja chy.English: What's this? This is already my chamber, hast ye forgotten? \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>No domariše, schovaj qahwah. N.English: <Wordwrap>Mother… hide quahwah. We hath been caught in the act, in flagrante delicto. \n<Valér>

<Wordwrap>Páni, ukľudnime sa. Toto je či.English: <Wordwrap>Let us temper our spirits, gentlemen, for this is but a matter of commerce. I am but a cog in the wheel of distribution. Behold, qahwah doth be unprocessed. We hath no dealings with the cultists. \n<Burgmaster>

<Wordwrap>Zatajovali ste nám informácie.English: <Wordwrap>Matters would hath progressed more smoothly had ye divulged pertinent information sooner. We squander time now. The lord shall not take kindly to this. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Ja nepodlieham zemepánovi, nec.English: <Wordwrap>I bend not my knee to the lord. Let him attempt to force his hand with armed men. My ties to the nobility run deep. I am allied with the Pálffys, though such alliances may be beyond your ken. \n<Burgmaster>

<Wordwrap>Mne može byc jedno, s kym sa t.English: <Wordwrap>I care not for thy alliances! For withholding vital knowledge, I hath the authority to mete out punishment to both of ye. Speak! What know ye? \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Náš zdroj je istý Koreň. Nikto.English: <Wordwrap>Our source is a man known as Root. His origins remain shrouded in mystery. Yet, he orchestrates caravans from Ethiopia, a land distant and foreign. But then he grewth audacious, threatening us with dire consequences should we defy him. We acquiesced, yet should we maintain our silence and compliance, trade shall continue unhindered. He hast even consented to furnish us with qahwah at half the price. \n<Burgmaster>

<Wordwrap>Tak sme si s ním na to štrngli.English: <Wordwrap>So, we hath struck a bargain with him. Yet, we nurtured hopes that someone would stir an inquiry. By the grace of God, we hath taken measures and stand ready to depart with haste. \n<Valér>

<Wordwrap>Myslíte si, že vás prepustíme?.English: And dost thou presume we shall simply permit thee to depart? \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Valér tým, že sme sa pripravil.English: <Wordwrap>Colleague Valér doth imply that even without thy involvement, we were engaged in the struggle against the cultists. We were loath to imperil our trade with the specter of war. 'Twas folly, nay, futility to engage thus. Bereft of means, we could take no decisive action. \n<Burgmaster>

<Wordwrap>A celý čas popritom zhromažďuj.English: <Wordwrap>Thus, through a certain colleague we sought another contact from the distant lands of Ethiopia and readied ourselves to flee this accursed village. All the while, we hath been amassing an arsenal. We hath dispatched missives to the nobles, yet Root holds sway in the highest courts. \n<Burgmaster>

<Wordwrap>Všetci nás ignorujú. Však to n.English: <Wordwrap>We are but disregarded by all. 'Tis an injustice. Hunyadi should hath intervened long since, yet perchance he is entangled in internal strife. 'Tis a formidable challenge to unveil the truth to the populace. Those who hath not witnessed these horrors firsthand shall scarcely lend credence. But with the help of the mentioned colleague, things were finally put in motion. We offer ourselves as comrades, more resolute as the backing from Prešov. \n<Burgmaster>

<Wordwrap>...s pomocou Ignáca?? Takže to.English: <Wordwrap>...with the help of Ignác? Thou art the Bur from his calendar! How come I didn't think of it, how foolish of me! And how dost thou really expect us to trust thee now? \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>No a čo, že s Ignácom? Pre dob.English: <Wordwrap>So what? For a good cause, I will work even with Jiskra. I do not take him to be my wife, what will be in a week is in the stars.\n<Burgmaster>

<Wordwrap>Neznam, či pravdu hutorice. Al.English: <Wordwrap>I know not if ye words bear the seal of truth, yet if they do, why didst ye delay their divulgence? \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Sme nevedeli, či vám môžeme ve.English: <Wordwrap>We harbored suspicions regarding thy trustworthiness. Ye could hath been agents of Root or bribed informants. I hath kept a vigilant watch upon thee since yesterday. We had not intended to confront thee so soon, but fate hath brought us together. \n<Valér>

<Wordwrap>Ta dobre potom, dze toten vaš.English: And where, pray tell, dost ye house this arsenal? \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Na fare v kostole. Pip dovolil.English: <Wordwrap>It dwells within the confines of the church's rectory. The preist granted Valér entry in exchange for a reduction in qahwah prices, holding the key to the hidden chamber. However, he vanished yesterday. \n<Burgmaster>

<Wordwrap>Ale veď sa nás práve na ulici.English: <Wordwrap>But did not thy minions assail us in the streets? Thy account appears incongruous. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>To boli kultisti, nanútili nám.English: <Wordwrap>These hat been the disciples of the cult, thrust upon us as guardians. Those two dimwits were naught but spies. I hath wager me last, they hath received orders to silence me. \n<Burgmaster>

<Wordwrap>No, ale keď nás teda necháte ž.English: <Wordwrap>Should thou grant us continued existence, we shall take our leave with all haste. Yet, the conundrum remaineth the cultists maintain watch over every road leading from the village, and our own guards hath proven as unreliable as a wisp of smoke. We cannot flee unaided. We beseech thy protection, and in exchange, we offer three hundred coins. \n<Valér>

<Wordwrap>Maceju, možeme im veric podľa.English: Matej, dost ye deem them trustworthy? \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Neviem... keď na nich kultisti.English: <Wordwrap>I know not... should the cultists assail them, then we shall know their words hold true, and the cultists held them ensnared. Yet, 'tis also possible it be a trap, and should we join them, we would be at their mercy. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>No Zbohem, ta co zrobime…\n\\n.English: By God, what path shall we tread... \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Hlavne to nekomplikujme. Zbehn.English: <Wordwrap>Above all, let us not complicate matters further. We shall seek an audience with the Lord, petitioning for a handful of stalwart men to bolster our ranks. Accompanied by the village mayor, we shall monitor the unfolding events. And Valér shall accompany us as a pledge of sincerity. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Valér sa pridal do tvojej druž.English: And so, Valér joined your party.

<Wordwrap>Tu žiju toty Pallmerofci. Co t.English: <Wordwrap>This is where those Pallmers live. Whose daughter knows something about the cult. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Dojdzem sem potem s Macejom.\n.English: I'll come back with Matej by my side.\n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Dobry. Zemepan i z richtarom m.English: <Wordwrap>Good morrow to thee. The lord and the burgmaster hath entrusted me with a quest to unravel the mystery of the cult blights this land. 'Tis said yer daughter knows something about it. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Anička sa nám odcudzila, domov.English: <WordWrap>Anička, she hath distanced herself from our hearth, scarce returning home. Only yesterday doth we berate even laid hands on her. Come dawn, she was not to be found in her chamber. Whether she shall return, we know not. \n<Pallmer>

<Wordwrap>Nič nám nevravela, ale voľačo.English: <Wordwrap>Nay a word hath she spoken to us, yet she hath been seen to etch into this tome.  We doth made her learned, alas we are unable to decipher its contents. Despite our toil, this is her recompense. \n<Pallmer>

<Wordwrap>Ukažce sem. \"Zima 1444... abo.English:
Give me the diary.
"Winter 1444... or 1448? I w-e-n-t to see my great mother tob... today in Sobram... Sobrance? Sobrance. She made cheese pies-" Ye know what, we'll turn gray until I get trough it. I shall return with Matej.\n

<Wordwrap>Za richtarom idzece? V strede.English: <WordWrap>Going to the burgmaster? Lives in the middle of the town.\n<Villager>

<Wordwrap>Zgruchotal. Jak še mu to podar.English: <Wordwrap>Down he goes. How he managed to slip on flat ground, that is far beyond me.\n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Me vykradli! Teraz, za biľeho.English: <Wordwrap>They've robbed me! In broad daylight! I merely went to my neighbor's for a rake, and upon my return, my home was ransacked entirely. No one believes me, they claim I hid my own belongings. \n<Villein>

<Wordwrap>Som sem prišol sa pozreť z mes.English: <Wordwrap>I came from the city to witness the life of peasants. 'Tis nothing but nakedness, uncouthness. Drunkards abound. \n<Townsman>

<Wordwrap>Zajtra sobota chlopci! Pride š.English: <Wordwrap>Saturday comes the morrow, the trader shall come sell his wares! \n<Cottager>

<Wordwrap>Ale ale, pán richtár. Na prech.English: But what's this, good burgmaster? Taking a leisurely stroll?\n<Evil doer>

<Wordwrap>Máš proti tomu niečo?\n\\n<Ric.English: Dost thou take offense at my movements? \n<Burgmaster>

<Wordwrap>Neklamal! Zahlušia ho! poďme m.English: He doth speaks verily! They seek to silence him! Cometh, let us lend him aid! \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Tu máte 300 korún. Napriek tom.English: <Wordwrap>Take these 300 coins. Despite this, my family and I remain indebted to thee, noble sirs. Accept this ancestral ring. I hope to sway Palffy and garner support for our cause. Until then, may God watch over thee. \n<Burgmaster>

<Wordwrap>Získal si \\c[14]300 korún\\c[.English: You gained \c[14]300 coins\c[0] and an \c[14]ancestral ring\c[0].

<Wordwrap>Skúste ešte nájsť pipa, nech v.English: <Wordwrap>Try locating the priest, he will let thou to our arsenal. \n<Burgmaster>

<Wordwrap>Jaj, ešči zas teho kdzeška nah.English: <Wordwrap>Lord in heaven, what an endless task, locating that man.\n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Možno tie dievčatá v nevestinc.English:
<Wordwrap>Mayhaps the bathmaidens will tell us of his whereabouts.
\n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Ideme takoj za zemepanom, povi.English: <Wordwrap>Let us hasten to the lord forthwith and apprise him of the events that transpired here. \n<Man at arms>

<Wordwrap>Konečne dniška dakus zapršalo..English: At last, it hath rained today. 'Twas so sultry, unbearable. \n<Cotter>

<Wordwrap>Ku rieke nechocce neš, molodci.English: <Wordwrap>Stay away from the river, lads. The Hussites hath seized someone and torment them in the water. \n<Cottager>

<Wordwrap>Idem k rieke na vodu. \\n<Obča.English: ...am off to the river for water. \n<Freeman>

<Wordwrap>Idze kuknuc k Pallmerofcom. Ho.English: <Wordwrap>Go see Pallmers. That faimily lives up in the village, right by the bridge. Their daughter Anička joined the cult, mayhaps they shall tell you about it themselves. \n<Freeman>

<Wordwrap>Panstvo važene! Byc vami ta ty.English: <Wordwrap>Respected folk! Should I be thee I wouldst flee with thee! Terrible things hath been happening here for months, but what has just occurred is unbearable! While they murdered us in the forest, I could still bear it. But to not be safe in a tavern, ‘tis the harbinger of doom.\n<Fugitive>

<Wordwrap>Respected folk! Should I be thee I wouldst flee with thee! Terrible things hath been happening here for months, but what has just occurred is unbearable! While they murdered us in the forest, I could still bear it. But for the burgmastrer to be slain, ‘tis the harbinger of doom.\n<Fugitive>

<Wordwrap>Nema cenu sa tu zdržovac ani d.English: <Wordwrap>'Tis no use lingering here even a day! Venture into the village not, the bridge is barricaded.\n<Fugitive>

<Wordwrap>Zahlušili nam richtara! Do dze.English: <Wordwrap>They hath murdered our burgmaster! Venture into the village not, the bridge is barricaded.\n<Fugitive>

<Wordwrap>Stojce! Ratujce še. V krčme ma.English: <Wordwrap>Halt! Steel thyselves. ‘tis a massacre in the tavern! Chaos reigns! A third of the people hath fled, a third art locked in their homes. A handful hath taken up arms and here we shall defend the bridge!

<Wordwrap>Chlopi! Caly valal hore nohamy.English: <Wordwrap>Lads! Chaos reigns! The burgmaster has been slain! A third of the people hath fled to the neighboring lordship, a third art locked in their homes, and the rest are God knows where. A handful of us hath taken up arms and we prepare for the worst. \n<Guardsman>

<Wordwrap>Moj kamoš pošol do lesa s delo.English: <Wordwrap>My friend went into the forest with a petard. He kept talking about some invisible monster, that he would extort it with the explosive. I haven't seen him in three days. \n<Woodworker>

<Wordwrap>Sme ho našli. Je mi to ľuto, u.English: <Wordwrap>We found him. I'm sorry, he's not coming back. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Do pyska! Skym budzem chodzic.English: <Wordwrap>Damn it! With whom shall I venture into yon forest now? Well, sir, thank you for coming to tell me. Here's his spare \c[14]petard\c[0], he won't have use for it anymore. \n<Woodworker>

<Wordwrap>Toto hrozny kraj. Mi vravel st.English: <Wordwrap>This is a terrible land. My grandfather told me that his grandfather had been killed by Mongols, and that his grandfather's grandfather had been killed by Tartars. And we are beaten by Hussites and even more sinister beasts from the forest. \n<Woodworker>

V sude objavil si \\c[14]zákys\\c[0]..English: In the barrel you found \c[14]sour cream\c[0].

Vo vreci našiel si \\c[14]zásoby\\c[0]..English: In the bag you found a \c[14]toolkit\c[0].

Na ohníku sa prihrievala \\c[14]kaša\\c[.English: In the fireplace the \c[14]porridge\c[0] was kept warm.

Amencma s našim valaľom. Kultisti zaútoč.English: Moonless night befell this hamlet. The cult attacked. \n<Cottager>

<Wordwrap>Nikto sa nesmie dostac do dzed.English: None shall pass into the village! \n<Marek>

<Wordwrap>Ďalší kultisti idú do dediny!.English: <WordWrap>More fiends approach our village! Haste, noble knights, to the church!\n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Nechajte ma! Vy lotri! \\n<Žid.English: Let go of me! You villains! \n<Jew>

Videl som ho do kostola utekať! \\n<Mate.English: I saw him fleeing towards the church! \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Chlopaci moji, no kdepak ste b.English: <Wordwrap>My comrades, where hath thou been? I hath been holding them off as best I could, but they hath overwhelmed me soon! \n<Kandich>

Ľudze boži, šmerc v očoch mam! Berce noh.English: <WordWrap>O, heavens! My heart quivers with fear! Quick, save thyselves, for the cultists set the village ablaze.\n<Fugitive>

Žida si videl? Vrav!\\n<Adam>.English: Hath you seen the Jew? Speak! \n<Adam>

<Wordwrap>Žida? Co, vy sce mu rodzina? I.English: <Wordwrap>The Jew? Are you all kin to him? He went to the church to fortify it along with the entire village. But they caught him first and torment him beyond the bridge. I had more sense and chose the opposite direction. Flee with me, good people! I know not how long thy can defend the church. ‘Tis besieged.\n<Fugitive>

Sme ich riadne dobili, ale hore pri kost.English: <WordWrap>We hath dealt them a heavy blow, but the battle still rages near the church. \n<Knight>

Mrchy jedne kultistické. Toľko hrôzy spô.English: Wretched cultists! Such horrors hath they wrought. \n<Knight>

Postavíme baranidlo, kult sa má načo teš.English: We shall build a ram! The cult has a lot to look forward to. \n<Knight>

<Wordwrap>Väčšinu sme ich zahnali na úte.English: <Wordwrap>Most of them hath fled back to their lair, we now know its entrance, yet without a ram, we cannot breach it. I hath ordered its construction. Strange fragrant smoke emanates from within the crevices. \n<Jozef>

Netreba nič stavac, ich vydurime.\n\\n<P.English: We need no construction, we shall force them out. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Väčšinu sme ich zahnali na úte.English: <Wordwrap>Most of them hath fled back to their lair, we now know its entrance, yet without a ram, we cannot breach it. I hath ordered its construction. Strange fragrant smoke emanates from within the crevices. \n<Ďusi>

<Wordwrap>Toto tu už nie je celkom člove.English: <Wordwrap>Verily, this creature is no longer of human kin, but a demon who hath wrought all our miseries! \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Pľujem na teba, beštia! Za moj.English: I spit upon thee, foul beast! For the sake of my two offspring! \n<Villager>

<Wordwrap>Pauli! \\! Hahaha... chrk... p.English: <Wordwrap>Paula! Hahaha… cough... pthuy... Thou... dost thou pelt stones at me with the villagers? ...who would hath thought we would end up as such. \n<Marek>

To je tota bosorka, čo nam dzeci trovila.English: 'Tis the witch who hath brought us calamity! Burn the vile woman! \n<Villager>

<Wordwrap>TICHO! Padajte domov kravy doj.English: <Wordwrap>SILENCE! Cease this tumult, ye peasants! This is not the place for mob justice, but for the halls of justice and the rightful executioner's hand. \n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Stichnite! Sedlač biedna! Toto.English: <Wordwrap>Quiet! Hold thy tongues, ye downtrodden serfs! This matter belongs before the court, with proper hearings and lawful judgment. Let not chaos rule. \n<Ďusi>

<Wordwrap>Uhni ty fras, bo i ty dostaneš.English: <Wordwrap>Away with thee, fool, lest thou meet thy end! Thou hast idled while calamity befell us all! \n<Villager>

Pali, odsekni jej hlavu! Za môjho brata!.English: Pali, sever her head! For my brother! \n<Peasant>

<Wordwrap>Rychlo ju dobi! Šak nas ešči o.English: <Wordwrap>Quick, put her down! Lest she bewitch us anew and sow chaos. She deceiver, pretending. She could strike thee down like a serpent. \n<Ida>

<Wordwrap>No jistě, vodsekni ji hlavu, d.English: <Wordwrap>Indeed, sever her head, for did she not stab thee when thou wert defenseless?! Look at her now, playing her pathetic theatre, trembling and weeping, a bubble forming from her nose. \n<Kandich>

<Wordwrap>Zbav sa jej! Teraz plače, ale.English: <Wordwrap>Be rid of her! Though she weeps now, 'tis all theater! She will summon new monsters upon us as soon as thou turnest thy back.\n<Man at arms>

<Wordwrap>Jake divadylko, čo si slepy? Š.English:
What theatre, art thou blind? She trembles... God, she even barfed. Full of fear, that poor soul. Do not be foolish, Pali, lest thou permit these peasants to take justice into their own hands. Thou hast enough blood on thy hands, the sect is finished, and without it, she can do naught. I shall try to convince the villagers that she was bewitched and drugged.
Send her away, for nothing good awaits thee with this woman.\n

Pali, ty musíš vedieť, čo spraviť.\n\\n<.English: Pali, thou alone know what must be done. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Trimce šicke piču!\\! Hovno sa.English: <Wordwrap>Begone, foul-mouthed wretches! Thou knowest naught of my heart's counsel. I may grant forgiveness to whomsoever I choose. Paula, come take a walk with me. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>A co ty s ňu, ty koňu? Cebe di.English: <WordWrap>And what of thee, thou nag? 'Tis not thy children hast she bewitched! \n<Villager>

<Wordwrap>Pauli, ma ľubiš ešči dakus vob.English: <Wordwrap>Paula, dost ye still love me at all? But tell me not a lie, for I shall strike the down on the spot. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Ja neviem... asi nie.\\n<Paula.English: I doth not know... probably not. \n<Paula>

<Wordwrap>Poďme naspäť, Pali... si zaslú.English: <Wordwrap>Let us return, Pali... I deserve death... only... when I am terribly afraid. Find thyself another woman, for I do not even hath regrets for what thou hast endured for me. \n<Paula>

<Wordwrap>Och...\\! \nTa... šak ja ci ro.English:
Oh... \!

<Wordwrap>Pali... čo ti mám na to poveda.English: Pali... what am I to say to thee? \n<Paula>

<Wordwrap>Na druhý deň sa Matej, Vlado a.English: <Wordwrap>Upon the morrow, Matej, Vlado, and Adam did return into the Meat keep to perform the Mass, and with the hallowed water thus created, they did quench the burning hearts of the Meat keep forevermore. After a week, Matej bid farewell unto this land and journeyed back unto Debrecen.

<Wordwrap>Zemepán Jozef spolu so židom n.English: <Wordwrap>The lord Jozef along with the Jew in the following years of peace in Felvídek devoted themselves to the invention of the book press. Unfortunately, Gutenberg surpassed them by several years. Hence, their invention did not take hold.

<Wordwrap>Inkvizítor Adam bol poverený s.English: <Wordwrap>Inquisitor Adam was tasked with the management of the lord's castle, but after a year, he yearned for the hustle of Košice. The castle he left in the care of the brave knight Ďusi.

<Wordwrap>Richtár spolu s Valérom šikovn.English: <Wordwrap>The burgmaster, along with Valér, cunningly utilized their contacts in Ethiopia and established the main distribution hub for the delivery of qahwah to surrounding lands. Felvídek flourished. After years, Felvídek was spoken of as the most sober land far and wide. Priest Vlado even submitted a request to the Vatican for permission for the holy liturgy with qahwah instead of wine.

<Wordwrap>Po richtárovej smrti sa po oko.English: <Wordwrap>After the burgmaster's death, dreadful rumors of events in Felvídek spread throughout the vicinity. The land then slowly declined.

<Wordwrap>Po rokoch služby na hrade Anič.English: <Wordwrap>After years of service at the castle, Anička wrote memoirs about the dreadful events in Felvídek, which entered history as "The Unbelievable Events at Felvídek in the Year of Our Lord 1451." Generally, it is regarded as a fabricated tale, and gradually, it faded into obscurity.

<Wordwrap>O osude lupičky Idy sa mnoho n.English:
<Wordwrap>
Little is known about the fate of the rogue Ida. However, a gossip lingered in the taverns for a long time that anyone who once joined the cult of Zurvan, Ida would find them and render them dead.

<Wordwrap>Ako presne pokračoval príbeh P.English: <Wordwrap>How precisely Pali's story continued, no one knows for certain. The only thing that is known is that Pali once again joined the struggle against the Ottomans in the Balkans.

<Wordwrap>Už ma to ďalej nebaví, Bože, t.English: <Wordwrap>I don't like it anymore, God, I didn't want this. I'm fed up with everything. May it be Sunday already.\n<Bathmaid>

Fíha, duchovenstvo aj šľachta, to k nám.English: <Wordwrap>By the saints, the clergy and the nobles both, such esteemed guests we seldom receive. How may I be of service to thee? Art thou come for revelry?\n<Bathmaid>

V mene Otca i Syna i Ducha Svätého. \nKe.English: <Wordwrap>In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. If Father Gejza were to see me here, he would flay the skin from my bones. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Še ukľudni, tu nijaky Gejza ne.English: <Wordwrap>Fret not, there be no Father Gejza, and these lasses would scarce lay a finger on ye, save to strip ye of ye clothes. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Mysli na to, že ideme za pipom.English: <Wordwrap>Consider that we are going after a priest, a holy man. 'Tis akin to attending Mass.\n<Pavol>

Tam je, farizeus jeden!\\n<Matej>.English: Lo, there he sits, that Pharisee. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Pip! Z akého titulu tu sedíš?.English: <Wordwrap>Priest! By what decree dost thou recline in this place? 'Tis thy duty to safeguard these maidens from the clutches of the devil, yet thou partakest in devilry alongside them. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>A tá chuderka babuška, čo tri.English: <Wordwrap>And what of the poor grandmother who languished three days awaiting confession? I was dispatched by Archbishop Gejza himself to scrutinize thy conduct in this forsaken realm, yet now I find myself sorely disillusioned. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Čo tak agresivne rušite moju k.English: <Wordwrap>Why dost thou rudely intrude upon my solitude, with cups of qahwah after carnal indulgence? Old Anča, thou sayest? 'Tis news to mine ears. Did she, perchance, confess unto thee her curses upon her brother-in-law's grave? She bore resentment, for he took her sister and not herself. Rest assured, Thee can absolve me from the clutches of the church, but for now, I beseech thee, leave me to my peace.\n<Priest>

<Wordwrap>Sprosták jeden! Vidím, že ani.English: <Wordwrap>Thou art a fool! It appears that even the sanctity of the confessional holds no sway over thee. 'Tis imperative to tread the ascetic path of John the Baptist. A pure soul must walk in tandem with bodily purity! \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Moja ric nech je čista. Ja tvr.English: <Wordwrap>Let my ass be pure. I maintain that so long as one does no harm, God views the curtailment of one's freedom as the gravest offense. True kindness must spring forth from the free will, for all else is but a façade. Doth my pursuit of women offend the divine? Nay, for did not He fashion those very behinds? \n<Priest>

<Wordwrap>Svätá panenka Mária… Čítal si.English: <Wordwrap>God above... Hast thou not perused the New Testament? Art thou acquainted with the teachings of our Lord, Jesus Christ. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Novy čo? Šak len toten jeden j.English: <Wordwrap>The 'New' what? I know only one Testament, the one that is a few millenniums old. I must confess, I am remiss in my studies. \n<Priest>

<Wordwrap>Smilstvo oslabuje tvoje svedom.English: <Wordwrap>Lust doth corrode the soul until it is naught but rot. Thou pratest of freedom, yet art but a servile thrall to sin, bound to the feet of women. Thou hast no freedom. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Priviazať sa k ženskym noham?.English: <Wordwrap>Bound to a woman? 'Tis an experience I hath yet to encounter, but... mayhap someday. Yet know ye not that one savors life's pleasures most when not ensnared by them? Dost thou think I yearn for a virtuous wife to cherish? That, methinks, would mark the end of revelry. \n<Priest>

<Wordwrap>Sloboda znamená slobodu konať.English: <Wordwrap>True freedom is the liberty to perform good deeds. Thy words confound me. Why doth thou prescribe to the church whilst daring to flout its precepts? \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Kvôli peniazom a tomuto ruchu..English: <Wordwrap>For the coin and the sway it bestows. When ensconced within its walls, my thoughts carry weight. Celibacy is but a trifle, akin to tattered raiment. Dost thou not see? The village now harbors a brothel, and 'tis of my making. \n<Priest>

<Wordwrap>Už mám dosť tvojich heretickýc.English: <Wordwrap>I hath heard enough of thy heretical prattle! I shall cleave thee asunder, thou vile creature! Come forth and face me! \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Dobre, dobre! Už nekrič toľko..English: <Wordwrap>Very well, very well! Cease thy bellowing. Should I lose by fair means, I shall willingly vacate the church. Yet if victory be mine, thou shalt not cast me out. Let us make this pact. \n<Priest>

<Wordwrap>No, fararu. Maceja som takeho.English: <Wordwrap>So be it, priest.  I hath never seen Matej so incensed before. Mayhaps ye gained muscles from that fornication. \n<Pavol>

Mlč aj ty. Tiež máš na rováši.\\n<Matej>.English: Hold thy tongue, thou art as culpable as him. \n<Matej>

Vzácne panstvo, idem sa ešte vycikať.\\n.English: Noble sirs, I shall take my leave to relieve myself. \n<Priest>

<Wordwrap>Rozprávaj sa s nimi ale radšej.English: <Wordwrap>Then thou shalt converse with them, for 'tis unseemly for me to gaze upon their scantily clad forms. \n<Matej>

Pocme nakuknuc, isto daco sa fajne dzifč.English: <Wordwrap>Let us go and have a peek, mayhap something hath been gleaned by the pleasant maidens since yestereve. \n<Pavol>

One feeds them, torn food from thy mouth, and this is to be our gratitude! I shall retreat to the Book of Job, for I know not what else to do, I am utterly despondent. \n<Guardsman>

<Wordwrap>Ta čemu toto naš vaľal poscihl.English: <Wordwrap>And why hath our valley fallen into such disarray? I know, we've neglected our prayers, the priest the root of it all. He's the one chasing skirts here, I shall give him what-for, pitchfork up his backside. \n<Guardsman>

<Wordwrap>Ci pana, ty ši bars šumny. Nec.English: <Wordwrap>Oy, thou art quite boisterous. Wouldst thou not venture beyond with me? We could amuse ourselves with some game. I hath baked a bublanina; perhaps thou wouldst care to join? Thou mayest bring a friend, I care not. \n<Cottager>

<Wordwrap>Jaj, kdeže toten moj parobok z.English: <Wordwrap>Oh, where hath my apprentice gone again, not seen him all day. And neighbor Anička has vanished too! Oh truly, the priest ought to speak of these matters at Mass, to cleanse souls! But when he too dallies with devil's tricks! The fish stinks from the head, 'tis all heading to hell with our folk! \n<Villein>

<Wordwrap>Ty ši Maja? Sme ci prišli pomo.English: <Wordwrap>Ye art Maja? We're here to help you seduce Vlado, may he calm down. If he cannot be content in celibacy, may he at least have a good wife and not frequent the brothel. Don't ye know what he likes?\n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Chlopi, Vecheť je moje meno, p.English: <Wordwrap>Good folk, I am Dick, and I beseech your aid! They are drowning Weenie! I will join you and do whatever you ask, just let us save him.\n<Dick>

<Wordwrap>Nie! Nie, nie, nie! Nebite ma,.English: <Wordwrap>Nay! Nay, I pray thee, spare me! I renounce Zurvan, I'll do aught for thee, only spare me! \n<Dick>

Šak my zname, že še ho vzdaš. Stači ce k.English: <Wordwrap>We know ye wilt renounce him. A little pressure on the rack shall do. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Veď práve! Obalamutíme ho, bud.English: <Wordwrap>Indeed! Let us confuse him, that he may deem us his allies. Surely then shall he lead us to his commander. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Koukej, ryba se neumí nadechno.English: <Wordwrap>Behold, a fish cannot breathe in the air. Return it forthwith, do not harm it, Honziku! Do not be foolish, lower the rope! \n<Hussite ruffian>

<Wordwrap>Dyť ryby nedejchaj, vole, seš.English: <Wordwrap>But fish doth not breathe, ye mother… Art thou completely daft? They merely hath eat water ang get those... ye mother… nutrients or what of it, ye mother… \n<Hussite pillager>

<Wordwrap>Slava Isusu Christu. Rád vidím.English: <Wordwrap>Praise be to Jesus Christ. I am gratified to witness the sacred inquisition in action. Might we observe how 'tis done? \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Když se chceš dívat na proces.English: <Wordwrap>When ye wish to observe an inquisition process, bring us some fine maidens, ye know, without a proper wench, 'tis not a true inquisition. \n<Hussite ruffian>

A se mnu by ši še nechcel pomarovac? Ric.English: <Wordwrap>And dost ye not wish to join me for some merry-making? I reckon I hast a sturdy rear like a mare. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Pohlednej seš, ale raději bych.English: <Wordwrap>Thou art comely, but I would prefer the monk, so that all is in harmonious accord with the love of God. What sayest thou, fair one? \n<Hussite ruffian>

<Wordwrap>Boha, Maceji, to už še neda po.English: <Wordwrap>God, hath mercy, Matej, this is unbearable. I hath expect provocation in vain. Let us decimate them! \n<Pavol>

Dobre dedko, niečo vám prinesieme. Len c.English: <WordWrap>Good fellow, we shall bring thee something. Just go back to the water so that no honorable old dame may stumble upon thee here.\n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Možem osrac caleho Zurvana i z.English: <Wordwrap>Curses upon Zurvan and his accursed cult! We've been hoodwinked! Many hath heeded their call, but I'm not so easily led astray. \n<Cultist>

<Wordwrap>Ja som netušila, že nás pošlú.English: <Wordwrap>I never imagined they'd send us to fight against our own kindred. They promised wilt be rallying against the Hussites! But when they ordered us to poison a few souls in the village, it doth not sit well with me. They claimed it was necessary. Now, however, I no longer place my trust in their words. Why must we raze the village? I refuse to spill the blood of my own kin! \n<Cultist>

Nevidíš dvojito, brat môj nešťastný, jeh.English: <Wordwrap>Nay, thou seest not double, my hapless brother. His two sons are joined as one, twinned by fate. \n<Matej>

Co?! Pane Kriste na nebesiach, panenko M.English: <Wordwrap>What?! Lord Christ in heaven, Virgin Mary protect me. Wherefore is my sword? \n<Pavol>

Dajak barz bľuvno mi. Toto ne je normaln.English: <Wordwrap>Somehow I feel queasy. This is not normal, what I am witnessing here! Matej, stand by me, for I am as fearful as a child! \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Možem to tu cale osrac. Sľubil.English: <Wordwrap>Could bloody well curse this entire place. Promised we wouldst drive the Hussites from our lands. Instead, they forced us to attack our own village. Those who doth not flee met their end. Only mutants remain. \n<Disilusioned cultist>

<Wordwrap>Kedysi to býval Komár, tak ho.English: <Wordwrap>Once ‘twas named Komár, 'tis what they called him throughout the village. We feed it by impaling people into the ground, then dousing them with qahwah. Even now, we stand upon the Komár's bowels. \n<Disilusioned cultist>

<Wordwrap>Hehehehe... thee burning meeee. Angra Mainyu within me sees everything, reads all like through glass, I understand everything. \n<Marek>

<Wordwrap>Co chcece tu ešči, paľce do Ma.English: <Wordwrap>What dost thou still want here, thou wretch? Too late hath ye come, fools! We've already dug the pit to hell! I am an immortal demon! \n<Marek>

<Wordwrap>Kráľovský edikt, ktorý mi umož.English: <Wordwrap>The decree grant residence in Upper Hungary is forgery, yet bribe nobility and several palatines, the burgmaster's report and attempt to resolve situation remain unheard. Yet, it hath all spiral out my control. \n<Hasan Bey>

<Wordwrap>Títo moji malí falošní zurvani.English: <Wordwrap>These my small false Zurvanist gain connection to Persia branch. I underestimate Marek's past connection with Armenia, they still active. He subdu Ibn al-Chajjám there and correspond with him. \n<Hasan Bey>

<Wordwrap>Ten Chajjám im poslal tajné ve.English: <Wordwrap>Chajjám send secret verse for rituals and mystical magic lamp, in which Ahriman  imprisoned after lost battle with legendary Faramarz, son of Rostam, as written in the Shahnameh. Rimanská power they began outgrow control. \n<Hasan Bey>

<Wordwrap>A myslíte si, že Sultán tu má.English: <Wordwrap>Thou believe that the Sultan agents here, and Hungary innocent? There will spies even in Sultan's harem. <Wordwrap>Richtár to prezradil Ignácovi..English: <Wordwrap>The burgmaster hath revealed it to Ignác. In the ledger, it hath been written 'meeting regarding a deal with Ric'. Pali hath blurt it out to Paula in the tavern, and she hath told Marek. I hath been there as a captive. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Nuž a zároveň sa stali nezávis.English: <Wordwrap>Well, they become independent from mu organization of qahwah supplies. That be again Ignác's doing. <Wordwrap>No ako som spomínal, pravda o.English: <Wordwrap>As I mention, the truth about me reach Marek, and I become enemy one number to them. \n<Hasan Bey>

<Wordwrap>Ohromná sranda je to. A zárove.English: <Wordwrap>Tis tremendous fun. And it also confuse people, when you talk normal. afterwards, they don't recognize you. \n<Hasan Bey>

To za trest toto. Šicko som pre ňu robel.English: <Wordwrap>This is her chastisement. I labored tirelessly for her, yet see how she has repaid me. \n<Lady Pallmer>

<Wordwrap>Tu máte ešte šnapsu, to môj he.English: <Wordwrap>Take this flask, there's yet some schnapps left, a gift from my honored father hailing from Bavaria. Dobre vraví otec, takých Matúšov ešte po.English: <WordWrap>Indeed, the father speaks wisdom. Such fellows as Matúš are encountered all too frequently. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Joj, už teľo nefňukajce. Kedz.English: <Wordwrap>Cease your lamenting, for as you are indebted to us, we may hath a task in mind for ye. Yer daughter shall serve as our spy amidst the cultists. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Nič, kľud, riziko minimalne, n.English: <Wordwrap>Fear not, for the peril is minimal. She need only return to her companions, subtly inquire, and furnish us with intelligence should they plot any mischief. \n<Pavol>

Stratia moment prekvapenia.\n\\n<Matej>.English: <Wordwrap>They shall be bereft of their element of surprise. \n<Matej>

Uch. Anička, si ochotná dačo také robiť?.English: <Wordwrap>Ah, Anička, art thou prepared to undertake such a task? \n<Pallmer>

<Wordwrap>Spravím, čo len chcete. Vzdáva.English: <Wordwrap>I shall do as you command. I renounce my allegiance to Zurvan. 'Twas surely the influence of the cult that let my Matúš astray. He bears a good heart. \n<Anička>

<Wordwrap>Aj heslo k ich brlohu vám môže.English:
<Wordwrap>Even the password to their den I can reveal to you. At the gate, say "Qahwah over head." They gather in the fortress to the west.

<Wordwrap>Pana beka, to keľo tajnych cho.English: <Wordwrap>Dear God. How many more secret passages shall we uncover? The entire region is tunneled as if mines once lay beneath. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>To bul Deži. Fifľena ho v dzed.English: <Wordwrap>It was Deži. A damsel poisoned him in the village,made hime into the beast. \n<Ida>

<Wordwrap>Hogy csészné meg a kibaszott ö.English: <Wordwrap>Hogy csészné meg a kibaszott öreg lófaszát! Pištik!!! Help me don my armor immediately! And you, go ahead, the night watchman's squire shall accompany you. What sort of sword dost you wield? \n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Dobre, počkajte ma pred stodol.English: <Wordwrap>Very well, await me afore the barn; I must attend to a call of nature. Take Piťo with thee, for his nightly watch wanes, and he is now free to join the fray. \n<Ďusi>

<Wordwrap>Tá krásavica mi dala vínko, al.English: <WordWrap>That fair maiden gave me some wine, but 'twas so tart it didst rush through me. And told me that I am to meet her in the evening, here shall we gather.\n<Janči>

Môjtybože... podozrivú ženu máš, Pali. B.English: <WordWrap>Lord in heaven... thou hast a suspicious woman, Pali. A fiend.\n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Hlavne sa upokoj, tu ide o váž.English: <WordWrap>Peace, stay composed, this is serious. Janči, we must ascertain what vile purpose that witch doth harbor, we suspect dark meddlings are woven with that drink thou didst consume. Let us go to the lord.\n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Ta škoda, som sa tešil na rand.English: <WordWrap>Tis a pity, I looked forward to the rendezvous today... but if thou sayest my life is at stake, then I heed your warning. But I am not capable of going to the lord now, as I tremble within, and cold sweat runs down my spine.\n<Janči>

Nič to, bude musieť prísť hora za Mohame.English: For naught, the mountain must cometh to Mohamad.\n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Žijem pane, ale v bruchu mi bo.English: <WordWrap>I live, my lord, yet my belly swells as if a hundred worms did wriggle within. And the fever hath taken hold of me. But I feel somewhat better now, after that spoiled wine didst ill upon me.\n<Janči>

<Wordwrap>Do večera musíš byť v cajku. T.English: <WordWrap>By eventide, you must needs be in better health. That fiend hath fingers in some mischief, for you knowest well, a week hence, Feri vanished without a trace... I shall send another in your stead to seek Adam. \n<Jozef>

A vy mu aspoň sucháre a bylinný odvar hn.English: And you, procure at least some biscuits and a herbal decoction forthwith.\n<Jozef>

Och, oj... ta snaď sa mi priľepši po tot.English: Oh, pray it the herbs shall bring comfort. \n<Janči>

<Wordwrap>Jak tá Paliho nevesta pride, n.English: <WordWrap>When Pali's bride arrives, discreetly inquire of her condition, what she does in our domain. Ask her also of the wine. She may well lie to you, that deceitful wench, but remember all well. \n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>My ťa budeme sledovať, neboj n.English: <WordWrap>We shall follow you, fear not. Should things take a dire turn, we shall be close at hand. And if we lose track of thee in the woods or elsewhere, I have devised a pierced bag of ash upon your foot, and thus we may find you by it.\n<Jozef>

Tak, teraz čekaj a tvár sa zaľúbene.\nMy.English: <WordWrap>Now, await and feign affection. We shall keep watch from the gatehouse.\n<Jozef>

Jak to, že zos hradu prišla? Šak sme ju.English: <WordWrap>How hath she returned from the castle? We saw her depart afore.\n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>V kraju to tu začina byc straš.English: <Wordwrap>In the county, it get's more horrid every day. Today in the tavern plenty were murdered by the cultists, not even innkeeper was spared.\n<Man at arms>

<Wordwrap>Nőjön gitár a hasadba és a rák.English: <WordWrap>Nőjön gitár a hasadba és a rák pengesse!!! Pali, I swear by the Lord, I shall hang thee by the neck! You foul, drunken wretch, 'twas you who nearly brought us all to ruin. Away with you from my sight, Hülye!\n<Jozef>

Silence.

<Wordwrap>Dobrô, ja zatiaľ figúrky rozlo.English: <WordWrap>Very well, I shall arrange the pieces, you can play as white. I'll have some quails prepared, so we may dine heartily.\n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Nič, vravel som jej, že bárs p.English: <WordWrap>Nay, I told her how sick I was and that I have been feeling strange, yet she persisted in kissing me and bid me not to fear, assuring me that it would pass. She told me to accompany her somewhere, promising that all would be blissful, akin to paradise. She vowed to take care of everything. \n<Janči>

Aj som sa pýtal na víno a ona, že to špe.English: <WordWrap>I inquired about the wine, she claimed to have crafted it for me specially, saying it would grant me strength. \n<Janči>

<Wordwrap>Majce še na pozore. Byc ja zem.English: <Wordwrap>Be on guard! If I was milord, I'd close the gate and wait till Hyunady arrives with the army. 'Tis be insanity, what takes place around here.\n<Man at arms>

Dosť už bylín som vám veď dal. Nech si d.English: <WordWrap>Enough herbs I have given thee. Let him soak the hearbs in water and mayhap it shall improve.\n<Herbalist>
