Aj mňa porichtuješ, jak by trebalo?\\n<P.English: Wilt ye also aid me if I was in need?\n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Vravím ti, keď ťa dačo trápi,.English: <WordWrap>I tell thee, when something troubles thee, go pray at the altar. \n<Herbalist>

A vieš čo, tu maš a idz.\\n<Felčiar>.English: <WordWrap>Aye, very well. Take these and be gone. \n<Herbalist>

<Wordwrap>Keď sa pri oltari pomodlite, v.English: When ye pray at the altar, your wounds shall be healed! \n<Herbalist>

<Wordwrap>Skuste sami! U nas v kaplnke,.English: <WordWrap>Try it for thyself! In our chapel, or even in the village church if ye wish.\n<Herbalist>

<Wordwrap>Felčiarom som tu. Ratujem ľudí.English:
I am the herbalist. I aid folk when needed. 
I gather herbs for the sick and such. \n<Herbalist>

<Wordwrap>Aj mňa porichtuješ jak by treb.English: Wilt ye also aid me if I was in need?\n<Pavol>

Som sa bol modliť z rána. Ci beky, hovor.English: <WordWrap>Forsooth, I prayed at the altar in the morning. I tell you, my back straightened and my knees no longer hurt.\n<Herbalist>

<Wordwrap>Čo ty tu? \\n<Jozef>.English: <Wordwrap>What manner of business brought you hither?\n<Jozef>

Jožku, bi na poplach, stary hrad hori ja.English: Jozef, sound the alarm, the old castle ablaze lik' a torch! \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Tota zrucanina? Jej škoda nebu.English: <WordWrap>The old ruin? Its loss won't be mourned. Since even the Hussites ransacked it, naught but ill fortune resides there. Still, go there and see whether some mischievous youths set fire to it. But Pali... by the grace of God... Your stench precedes your presence by three yards. Why do you persist in pestering me whilst inebriated?\n<Jozef>

Ľen še mi čežko zašpava. \\n<Pavol>.English: Bah, just had a hard time falling asleep.\n<Pavol>

Héj tam, jasné. Kvôli žene chlastáš, pri.English: Clear as day, I shall believe you not. You carouse for the sake of a woman, admit it! \n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Ta kejc furt na ňu myšľim, šak.English: <WordWrap>Tis true, I cannot cease thinking of her, as I did warn ye. I am vexed beyond measure, lost I am. I know not what to make of it.\n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Sa spamätaj, Anciáša! Čo teraz.English: <WordWrap>Gather your wits, Anciáša! So what, are you going to drown yourself in sorrow over that? I too, lost a woman, yet you don't see me drinking dusk till dawn like a Tatár.\n<Jozef>

Počuj sem, ty oplan. Iď za Matejom ihneď.English: Listen here, you numskull. Go seek counsel from Matej right away!\n<Jozef>

Matejom? Toten mnich, co sem tyž nedavno.English: Matej? The monk who too recently reached our midst?\n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Hej, ten. Nach ťa dá dokopy s.English:
Yes, him. He will put you right with those endless prayers of his or whatever. What use are you to me in such wretched state? If not even holy water can aid you, I am at my wits end. \!
...and here, take this fig. Behold, it came from Pešť. \n

Ci dušu, ta to sladota. \\n<Pavol>.English: <WordWrap>Dear God, sweetness for my sould, I say.\n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>No, ale poď prv zahrať so mnou.English: <WordWrap>But come play something with me first. Such square cards have arrived, also from Buda. You have to flip two at a time and if you match them, you take them. It's merriment itself, Pexeso it's called .\n<Jozef>

Neee, daj pokuj... Idzem za totym švetym.English: Nay, len' me peace... I shall seek solace with yer saint.\n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Vidno, že na spoveď nechodíš č.English: <WordWrap>Clearly, you don't frequent the confessional. In the chapel at the end of the hallway. Just go right.\n<Jozef>

Kam sa náhliš? Najprv pekne ty za Matejo.English: Where are you rushing off to? First, go pay respect to Matej.\n<Jozef>

Joži, podz še kuknuc užaj, fras akysi mi.English:
Jozef, hasten to peer inside! Some monstrosity climbed into my window!
Fortune, that I fell asleep clad in armor.\n

<Wordwrap>Azanyát, Pali… znaš, že keby ť.English: <WordWrap>Azanyát, Pali... dost you know that had he slain you, after yestereve's affair, I would hardly lament? I was even bested by Matej... that rogue hath outwitted me, blocked all my moves.\n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Čo to je za ohavnosť? Pane na.English: <WordWrap>What manner of foulness is this? By the heavens, forsooth that creature must have emerged from the very depths of hell!\n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Boh nech nás ochraňuje. Ale hľ.English: <WordWrap>May God protect us. But look! It wears Janči's attire and armor. \n<Matej>

Co kejc to on sam? Barz dobre mu včera n.English: Is it not him? Verily, he was not in good spirits yesterday. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Išteném… toto bol náš Janči, k.English: <WordWrap>Isteném… this was our Janči, behold his countenance. Such crooked teeth in the castle he alone possessed. Likely, Feri fared similarly.\n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Toto nebude práca nejakej bied.English: <WordWrap>This is not the machination of some impoverished sect, nor even the Hussites. The band that assailed us on yestereve were heretics. They invoked a being named Zurvan. We are confronted with sorcery of the darkest kind! Surely, they did set upon him beneath the shroud of night to curse him! \n<Matej>

Isto mi aj ženu oni dopsuli! Šak ona čis.English: They must bewitched my wife as well! She, the purest maiden! 'Tis foul sorcery!\n<Pavol>

Ó, hogy bassza meg egy talicska apró maj.English: Ó, hogy bassza meg egy talicska apró majom! \n<Jozef>

No nič. Pištík, sem poď. \\n<Jozef>.English: Thus be it. Pištík, come hither. \n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Zober tú potvoru do ľadovne, h.English: <WordWrap>Take this fiend to the ice-house. Come the morrow, Adam shall arrive to us. He, schooled in the halls of learning, hath dissected corpses aplenty.\n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Choďte do dediny a richtárovi.English: <WordWrap>Venture to the town and apprise the burgmaster of our missing folk. A letter I shall pen, detailing the urgency of the matter.\n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>No aľe, chlapci moji, veď ešte.English: <WordWrap>But come, good fellows, we have yet to breakfast; let us engage in a game of Ludo during our meal. I have acquired it from Germany. Fear not, for with the toss of the dice, the pieces shall dance in jest, a spectacle of mirth indeed!\n<Jozef>

Nas nestrimuj, idzeme za totym richtarom.English: <WordWrap>Hinder us not. Let us pay the burgmaster a visit, and perchance sample a morsel at the inn.\n<Pavol>

Pištík! Rozkladaj pexeso! \\n<Jozef>.English: Pištík! Ready the game of Pexeso!\n<Jozef>

Našiel si 3 deci \\c[14]slivkového vína\.English: You found three bottles of \c[14]plum wine\c[0].

Drychmať môžeš inokedy..English: Slumber you will at another time.

V diaľke horí starý hrad..English: In the distance, the old castle is ablaze.

Výhľad na starý hrad pôsobí rovnako nešť.English: The view of the old castle appears as hapless as ever.

<Wordwrap>Čo moj? Šak len tam zájdi. Bar.English: <Wordwrap>Go forth. Just venture there. Do not incite them, merely present the painting. Tarry not, glean what knowledge thou canst, and return. \n<Jozef>

Už si našiel v kostole Bohdana? Choď ho.English: <Wordwrap>Hath you found Bohdan within the church? Waste no moment in your pursuit. \n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Budem aj ja s lukostrelcom obď.English: <Wordwrap>I shall accompany the archer at a distance. I doth not take lightly the prospect of sending thee into such peril. \n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Toho qahwah tam bolo strašne v.English: <Wordwrap>There was so much qahwah there. Most of the grains are unroasted, but we have already found grains with engraved symbols.  \n<Jozef>

Už ste boli v tej krčme? \n\\n<Jozef>.English: Have you been to the tavern yet?  \n<Jozef>

Nechceli ste ísť žida hľadať? Ja tu orga.English: <WordWrap>Didn't you want to go looking for a Jew? I organize the knights here, we go to help the villagers. \n<Jozef>

Bežte po Mateja, ja som hneď tam.\n\\n<J.English: Go get Matej, I'll be right there. \n<Jozef>

Teraz hybajte do krčmy! Možno ešte tam z.English: Now get moving to the inn! You may still find the Rot there. \n<Jozef>

Ale hej. Ten šach sa dá ešte. Pexeso hra.English: <Wordwrap>Aye, that I shall. The chess match be prefered. Playing Pexeso games, I could not bear. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Inač... jak si totim Husitom h.English: Anyway, as you told the Hussites... You heard Hus speaketh?\n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>V živote som nebol v Prahe! Ba.English: <Wordwrap>I've never been to Prague in my life! What's more, when Hus was burned, I was two years old, I wouldn't remember a fart anyway.\n<Matej>

Hehehe, ty si iny fiškus. \\n<Pavol>.English: Hehehe, you are more of a fox then I anticipated. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Musíme sa pripraviť na najhorš.English: <Wordwrap>We need to prepare for the worst.\n<Jozef>

Uskladnené je tu jedlo pre posádku hradu.English: Food for the castle crew is stored here.

Fľaška \\c[14]frndžalice\\c[0]. Neopovrh.English: A bottle of \c[14]frndžalitz\c[0]. We will not despise.

Toto svinstvo kedysi bol náš Janči..English: This mass of meat used to be our Janči.

Chudák Janči. Riadne sme ho dorichtovali.English: Poor Janči, hopefuly he doesn't mind how he ended up.

Koniec leta sa blíži, ľadu je však ešte.English: The end of summer is near, but there is still enough ice. It will last until winter.

Pan zemepan, som zistil, že na vás chyst.English: <WordWrap>Milord, I found out that they are planning to assassinate you! Run fast!\n<Ďusi>

<Wordwrap>Ďusi môj zlatý, teraz sme ich.English: <Wordwrap>Ďusi my darling, now we have put them down. But still, thank you very much for your effort, I can see that you are not slacking off. There was a fight just a few minutes ago. \n<Jozef>

Nič to, pôjdem ďalej Feriho hľadať!\\n<Ď.English: It's all right, I'll keep looking for Feri!\n<Ďusi>

Slava Isusu Christu. Ty si toten hlavny.English: Praised be Jesus Christ. Ye art the sanctimonious one?\n<Pavol>

Na veky amen, brat môj. Prečo rušíš moje.English: Praised be brother. Why dost thou disturb my contemplation? \n<Matej>

Poslal me za tebu zemepan. Treba se mnu.English:
The lord sent me hither. I am in need of something, I wander as if bereft of soul.
My lady hath forsaken me.\n

<Wordwrap>Brat môj, veľké nešťastie ťa p.English:
Brother, great misfortune hath befallen thee, but remember, 'tis written:
\"He healeth the broken in heart and bindeth up their wounds.\" Relinquish thy sorrow and give thy soul unto the Lord. Let go of spirits, for thou hast had thy fill by reason of the odour. Ten times recite the Lord's Prayer. May the Lord be with thee.\n

<Wordwrap>No, ta ďakujem pekne, že tak š.English:
Ha! I thank you kindly for relieving me of sadness over my wife so swiftly.
I immediately feel renewed, truly. If only I had know that a simple prayer would suffice. Clearly, in yer celibacy you know naught of trials that accompany wedlock. \n

Sluchaj ma bratu, poc se mnu prezreť sta.English:
Listen brother, come search the old castle with me. Something seems to be aflame,
a fire. \n

<Wordwrap>Čo si rozum potratil? Práve il.English: <WordWrap>Hath thou lost your mind? I am currently illuminating the Book of Lamentations of Saint Mark over the Israelites; leave me be with the fire. Any servant may accompany thee thither.\n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Nene, tak rozkazal zemepan. Ty.English: <WordWrap>Nay, so commanded the lord of the land. Ye must go, and that's final. To ensure the salvation of my weary soul. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Mňa sem poslal arcibiskup Gejz.English: <WordWrap>I was sent here by Archbishop Gejza of the Debrecín Parish for audition of a local priest, not for the treatment of local alcoholics. I shall make my grievance known to the lord of the land.\n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>...protiví sa mi opustiť ilumi.English: <Wordwrap>...though it vexes me to abandon my illumination... what is God's to God, and the Lord's to Lord. But brother, if I behold thee partaking of the cup... All shall be duly inscribed in this book, and I shall lodge a complaint with the lord of the land, dost thou comprehend?\n<Matej>

Dóbre veď, dobre. Podz už het, doraz tma.English: Alright then, alright.  Come now, the dusk is nigh.\n<Pavol>

Mních Matej sa pridal do tvojej družiny..English: Monk Matej has joined your band.

Pozrite. Ďuri bol medzi nimi. Včera ešte.English: <WordWrap>Behold, amongst them Ďuri, who just yesterday engaged me in a game of Pexeso. \n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Ty si tá Anička? Si mi krk zac.English:
Art thou Anička? Thou hast preserved my life. Without thee, I would have been caught unawares, squatting over the gameboard, playing against mine own self. Or worse, gazing at my fresco, adorning it. \!
Stead a sword in hand I wouldst… - \^\n

Zas nemusíš nám to tak farbisto vykresľo.English: Thou needest not render the scene so vividly. \n<Matej>

Tu máš 10 zlatých a dajakú robotu ti náj.English: <Wordwrap>Here, take these ten gold coins, and I shall procure you employment within the castle walls, sparing you from toil in the fields. \n<Matej>

Ona je vzdelaná, vie aj čítať.\n\\n<Mate.English: Verily, she is learned, she can read as well. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>No azanyát, však mi treba niek.English: <Wordwrap>Azanyát, we need someone to assist me with all these orders. I once had such a notion... that it could be done, could be a contraption, where you merely press a letter and from somewhere a stamp emerges, and the letter is imprinted on parchment. \n<Jozef>

Hmmm, ale nejak by sa muselo to písmenko.English: Hmmm, but the letter wouldst need to be inked somehow. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>No a ja mám čo robiť? Však som.English: <Wordwrap>And what am I to do? I am the only one left alive. I cannot just return as if nothing happened, with everyone else murdered. \n<Anička>

<Wordwrap>Akože bez škrabanca, však ťa v.English: <Wordwrap>As if without a scratch? Yet thy father beat thee like grain in the night. Show thee wounds, we wilt smeare you with pig's blood, and tear your clothes. \n<Matej>

To čisty blud. I tak budu znac, že ona b.English: 'Tis pure folly. Even so, suspicions shall linger, for she alone survived. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Vedieť nebudú, ale podozrievať.English: <Wordwrap>They may not know, but suspicion shall surely follow... Damsel, dost thou wish to undertake such a risk? We can harbor thee here, thou needst not embark upon this... thy aid hath been ample already. \n<Matej>

Skúsim… ale chcem, aby ste potom pustili.English: I shall endeavor... yet I would hath thee release Matúš thereafter. \n<Anička>

Stále ho miluješ? Po tom všetkom?\n\\n<M.English: Dost thou still hold affection for him? After all this? \n<Matej>

Jasné, že áno. Ale neviem, či ho chcem e.English: Aye, I do. But I know not if I wish to lay eyes upon him again. \n<Anička>

Láska, Bože, láska… dze ce ľudze beru? \.English: Ah, love, the enigma of the divine... whence doth it spring? \n<Pavol>

Vyhlasujem veľkú amnestiu na neveru.\n\\.English: I declare a great amnesty upon infidelity. \n<Matej>

Teho? Tutaj dole? Darmo ho tu hľadať.\\n.English: Him? Down here? No point seeking him here.\n<Pištík>

Pištík, ty si taky glupy jak toto drevo..English: Pištík, ye art as dull as this wood. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Pištík, idz do hradu a mi zože.English: <Wordwrap>Pištík go to the castle and fetch some wine or something. Let none see ye, and if anyone should inquire, tell them ye knowest naught. \n<Pavol>

Neznam, co som čekal.\\n<Pavol>.English: I knew not what I expected. \n<Pavol>

Povedzte zemepanovi, že už pexešo rozlož.English: Tell the lord the pexeso is ready.\n<Pištík>

Minule už som pochopil, jak sa pexeso hr.English: Methinks I finally understand pexeso. You have to match 2 cards.\n<Pištík>

Neznace dze je zemepan? Tu od rana čekam.English: <WordWrap>Where is milord? Do you know not? I'm waiting for him all morning with pexso.\n<Pištík>

Sudy pripravené na vínko. Zatiaľ smutné.English: The barrels are ready for some wine. For now, sadly empty.

V peci sa dačo pečie asi, zavoňalo..English: Mayhaps something is being baked in the oven. It smells pleasant.

Na peci ležia práve upečené \\c[14]suchá.English: There be fresh \c[14]biscuits\c[0] on the oven. You take them.

Krista, žena moja, ty sa tu budzeš obliz.English: <WordWrap>By Christ, my wife, dost ye seek to cavort with messengers? I shall not abide this affront; I shall rend her asunder like a serpent!\n<Pavol>

Drž ho! Chuju, popsuješ akciu! Azanyát!\.English: Hold him! By the heavens, you dost imperil our scheme! Azanyát!\n<Jozef>

Pauli, ty suka! Ja ťa zabijem! Ta ty tu.English: <WordWrap>Paula, ye harlot! I shall end ye! Dost ye spread yer legs here? I shall cleave ye limb from limb, by almighty God!\n<Pavol>

V tejto truhle ktosi skrýval \\c[14]fľaš.English: Someone hid a \c[14]bottle of wine\c[0] in this chest. It is now ours.

Sud bol plný \\c[14]zakysaného mlieka\\c.English: The barrel was full of \c[14]sour cream\c[0].

Konec stopy. Ta co še vyparili?\\n<Pavol.English: The trail's end. What manner of sorcery be this?\n<Pavol>

Buďte ticho obidvojo. Ty Pištik, caly de.English: <WordWrap>Silence, both of ye! Pištík, you hast been seated here all day. Didst you see Janči passing by?\n<Jozef>

Hej i s dajaku dievčinu. \\n<Pištík>.English: Aye, accompanied by a maiden fair.\n<Pištík>

Počúvajte, tu keď buchnem, duto sa to oz.English: Listen, when I strike here, it doth sound hollow.\n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Hmmm, tuhľa, skúsim na tehlu z.English: <WordWrap>Hmmm, mayhap pressing on this brick... Or perchance this one? This one doth seem to bear a different hue. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Pištík, čo si ihneď za mnou ne.English: <WordWrap>Pištík, why didst you not come to me forthwith? When such events take place, I must needs be informed!\n<Jozef>

Jaj, ja myslel že to naši tu chodia. Bo.English: <WordWrap>Oh, I thought 'twas our comrades arriving. 'Tis been a month since digging here started.\n<Pištík>

Bolond vagy! Na dereš pôjdeš! Teraz hneď.English: <WordWrap>Bolond vagy! Hollowhead! Torture shall seal thy doom!\n<Jozef>

Ser naňho teraz. Musime Jančiho najsc. Š.English: <WordWrap>Worry not for him at this hour. We must locate Janči with all haste, for my wife is alone with him.\n<Pavol>

Dobre. Poďme, no. A ty Pištík, ty sa teš.English: <WordWrap>Agreed. Let us proceed. And you, Pištík, prepare yourself.\n<Jozef>

Bratku, na teba som tu čakal... Nechceš.English: Comrade, I have awaited thy arrival... Wouldst ye join us?\n<Miscreant>

Jak čakal, šak ja som sem len zabludzil,.English: <WordWrap>Awaited? How? I wandered here by chance, for I know not what course to pursue.\n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Žiadna náhoda neexistuje, to h.English: <WordWrap>No mere chance exists, for the stars that have guided ye here. So, wilt ye join us or nay? Should ye join, we shalt accomplish great deeds, and ye shalt gain power beyond Hunyady's wildest dreams. If not, ye shalt perish in obscurity like a mut.\n<Miscreant>

Dobrá voľba. Poď, zavediem ťa medzi naši.English: A wise choice. Come, I shall lead ye amongst our ranks. \n<Miscreant>

Tu ťa kričať nikto nebude počuť.\\n<???>.English: No one shall hear you scream here.\n<???>

Paľko! Zachránil si calý kraj i moju duš.English: <WordWrap>Paľko! You saved me and my soul! There never was a better day than this one!\n<Paula>

Dám ti zato pol chotára do daru!\\n<Joze.English: <WordWrap>I will give you half of my domain!\n<Jozef>

Tak čo? Si si rozmyslel? Zahráme? \\n<Jo.English: So? Changed your mind? Shall we play?\n<Jozef>

Vidno, že na spoveď nechodíš často. V ka.English: <WordWrap>Clearly you don't frequent the confessional. The chapel is just right of here.\n<Jozef>

Kam sa náhliš? Najprv pekne ty za Matejo.English: Where are you rushing off to? First, go pay respect to Matej.\n<Jozef>

Čo vy tu ešte? Šak hybaj na stary hrad..English: <WordWrap>Why are you still here? Make haste to the old castle forthwith.\n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Jáj Pali, ty si snaď rozum pre.English: <WordWrap>Oh Pali, have you lost your mind to drink. Whence you depart the castle, just head north.\n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Dobry večer sa praje, Jožo. Ta.English: <WordWrap>Good eve to ye, Jožo. Hark ye well, we ventured forth and found strange doings still afoot. A burnt Turk lay there, and a curious musical instrument, Matej suspects it hails from the infernal depths. Methinks 'twould be better to summon Adam of Kassau hence.\n<Pavol>
<WordWrap>Good eve to ye, Jozef. Hark ye well, we ventured forth and found strange doings still afoot. A burnt Turk lay there. Methinks 'twould be better to summon Adam of Kassau hence.\n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Krisztušát! Turci? Isto sa bra.English: <WordWrap>Kristusát! Turks? Mayhap cohorting with some Hussite offshoot, or the like. I know not. There's scant moment of peace. Yet verily, Adam is a stout inquisitor, who hath caught many miscreants in Hungary.\n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Tu máte zapečatený list, kedve.English: <WordWrap>Here's a sealed letter, kedvesem. Make haste, deliver it unto knight Janči at the gate, that he may speed to Kassau forthwith.\n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Kukni še i na tote zrnka, ty š.English: <WordWrap>Take heed of yon seeds, ye art learned in such matters. They were scattered all around the old castle.\n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Hát, tak toto je interesantné..English: <WordWrap>Hát, intriguing, indeed. Albeit I am unfamiliar, I once heard from Count Eszterházy that such bitter water is brewed in Persia; mayhap this be it... Oh, woe is me, szivecske, but let us play a game of Mariáš, for we are but three, 'twill be swiftly done! \n<Jozef>

Neeee, daj pokuj, nemame času, idzeme za.English: <WordWrap>Nay, len' me peace, we lack time; let us go find yon messenger.\n<Pavol>

Ste si rozmysleli? Zahráme predsa? \\n<J.English: Hast you changed thy mind? Shall we play after all? \n<Jozef>

Pri bráne vravím. Totej, čo keď ňou prej.English: At the gate, I say. That one, whence you shalt depart the castle. \n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>No ako asi, platím výpalné Jis.English: <Wordwrap>How do you think? I pay off Jiskra, their leader. Of course It pains me, but otherwise we would end up like at Kapušany...\n<Jozef>

Veď v dedine, predsa. Tam sa spýtajte mi.English: <WordWrap>In the town, naturally. Inquire with the locals. \n<Jozef>

Szivecske, čo vy tu? Dačo už ste od rich.English: <Wordwrap>Szivecske, what brings you here? Hast thou learned aught from the burgmaster? \n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Sam neznam, co si mam mysľec..English: <Wordwrap>Myself am uncertain what to make of it. This priest brews a concoction from such beans as we found in the old castle ruins. Yet those found within the castle are tainted, and should one consume them, it could be one's undoing. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Toten pip, počuvaj, to samy pr.English: <Wordwrap>Aye, that priest is a thorn in our side. The burgmaster sent us in pursuit of him, seeking counsel. But after discovering him in the brothel, he hath vanished once more. \n<Pavol>

Čo je veľa, to je veľa. \\n<Jozef>.English: Indeed, too much of a coincidence. \n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>No čekaj. Tak sme ho v kosceli.English: <Wordwrap>Stay a moment. We found him in the church, and there we spoke of the beans. The very beans we found within the castle. He possesseth the same, brewing some manner of beverage from them. \n<Pavol>

Pravda. Qahwah to nazýval. \\n<Matej>.English: True indeed. He named it Qahwah. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Hej, tak. Akorat potom zdrhol.English: <Wordwrap>Aye, precisely so. Yet anon he vanished once more, sending his minions after us. \n<Pavol>

Ci pánečku. Ta vysnorte ho. \\n<Jozef>.English: God protect us. You must need go and seek him out. \n<Jozef>

Sebe predstav, že pipa sme v burdeli naš.English: <Wordwrap>Picture this, we found the priest in the brothel. Frolicking  away his sorrows. \n<Pavol>

Márnosť šedivá. Hát, s vyšetrovaním toho.English: <Wordwrap>Aye, a grim state of affairs. But that's unlikely to shed much light on our investigation of the cult. \n<Jozef>

Praveže asi i hej. Taky napoj tmavy tam.English: Mayhaps. He was partaking of something dark there. \n<Pavol>

Myslíš, že to z toho zrna v hrade? Šak m.English: <Wordwrap>Do you reckon 'tis from the beans in the castle? Though he might as well hath been swilling muddy water for all we know. \n<Jozef>

Zajimava nahoda by to bola. Ku všeckemu.English: <Wordwrap>It would be a curious twist of fate. And to make matters worse, he hath fled , and who knows where he hath taken refuge. \n<Pavol>

Skuste dačo ešte vyzistiť. \\n<Jozef>.English: You ought to endeavor to gather further intelligence. \n<Jozef>

Nas richtar poslal za pipom. \\n<Pavol>.English: The burgmaster sent us after the priest. \n<Pavol>

No. A ste za nim boli? \\n<Jozef>.English: Ah, and hath you found him yet? \n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Mno, husitoch sme Židovi vyhna.English: <Wordwrap>Well, we have succeeded in driving the Hussites from the Jew's home. They wrought havoc within... But that is of little consequence. He divulged some interesting tidings. The cultists don garments adorned with the teeth of vampires. Should ye encounter any such, detain them posthaste. \n<Pavol>

Interesantné, dobre vedieť. Dám hneď ved.English: <WordWrap>Interesting indeed, good to know. I shall promptly apprise the gurads as to they remain vigilant. \n<Jozef>

Židov dom dajaka husitska banda obsadila.English: The Hussite rabble has laid claim to the Jew's dwelling. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Šak ja viem. Sme sa rozpravali.English: <Wordwrap>Aye, I am aware. We spoke of it but moments ago. Those two lads accompanying you, I have tasked them with this mission. Perhaps you have forgotten. \n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Tak še veci maju. Žid vraj o k.English: <Wordwrap>So it stands. The Jew claims to possess knowledge concerning the cultists. However, the Hussites have seized his dwelling, and he vows not to speak until he reclaims his property. \n<Pavol>

No a teraz čo my? Akože mu ideme vyháňať.English: <Wordwrap>And what course shall we take now? Shall we endeavor to expel the Hussites from his abode? \n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Ta bolo by dobre. I zaplatil f.English: <Wordwrap>Twould be wise. He offered fair coin. Yet those Hussites, they swarmed within like flies upon dung. Alone with Matej, we shan't drive them hence. We require reinforcements. \n<Pavol>

Posily, hej? Pošlem s vami dvoch chlopoc.English:
Reinforcements, you say? I shall dispatch two lads to accompany you. Provide them with a few coins for ale afterward.
Let them not grumble. \n

Poslal nas richat žida hledac. Vraj kade.English: <WordWrap>The burgmaster hath sent us to consult the Jew. Supposedly, he knows many things. \n<Pavol>

Ešči ne, vraj v lese žije.\\n<Pavol>.English: Not as yet. He is said to dwell within the forest. \n<Pavol>

No! Barátok moji, tu ste konečne.\\n<Joz.English: Aye! My good brethren, here you are at last. \n<Jozef>

Sme pipa v lese hledali, ale to škoda re.English:
We were a-hunting for the priest in the forest, but that tale must wait.
Look who we took hold of for ye.\n

<Wordwrap>Milosť! Jhaaj, prosím! Pre šec.English: <Wordwrap>Mercy! I beseech thee! For all that is holy, I beg thee, do not harm me, nooo. I am but a poor wretch aaai! \n<Dick>

Stichni! Čo to za paholka ste sem dovlie.English: Silence! What manner of lad hath you brought here? \n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Kultista. Pri dedine sme ho na.English: <Wordwrap>A cultist. We found him near the village. We ensured no harm befell him. \n<Matej>

Tak to je skvost! Šup s ním na dereš.\\n.English: What a sight. To the rack with him. \n<Jozef>

Tak vykladaj! Kto je tvoj vodca? Kde síd.English: So speak! Who commands you?  Where doth he reside? \n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Nemôžem, oni so mnou zrobia am.English: <Wordwrap>Spare me! Nay, nay, nay! I mean thee no harm! I did not wish to join that cult, it was Weenie who coerced me, take him instead, noooo! I beg thee, no! Spare me. \n<Dick>

Kec takoj neodpoviš zemepanovi, ta papek.English: Should ye not answer the lord I wilt beat ye like a dog! \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>To nechcel som nikdy sa pridať.English: <Wordwrap>I never wanted to join them, never! They hath promised to drive the Hussites out of the land and help me fix my hut. I hath not know they doth such forbidden deeds. Someone, please, save me, please. I no longer serve Zurvan! Begone! Begone! Ooh! \^\n<Dick>

<Wordwrap>AAAAAh! Všetko vám poviem, vše.English: <Wordwrap>AAARGH… Spare me! I'll tell thee all, I swear! I know not his name, but he resides in a stronghold northwest from here. Oh, dear saints, what hath I done to deserve this? I hath wronged no one! \n<Dick>

Čo to splietaš? Jak si sa k tej bande do.English: What nonsense is this? How didst ye fall in league with that rabble? \n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Jojh, jojh. Pár mládencov od n.English: <Wordwrap>Oh, oh. Some lads from our village came by, talking of a group seeking recruits. They promised to arm us, clothe us. They claimed they would drive the Hussites away! I did not wish to join, but Ňuma persuaded me, forced me. \n<Dick>

Ako sa dostaneme do toho sídla?\\n<Jozef.English: How do we enter this stronghold? \n<Jozef>

Pri bráne sa vás spýtajú na heslo, odpov.English: <WordWrap>At the gate, they shall ask thee for a password. Reply with "Qahwah over head". \n<Dick>

<Wordwrap>Qahwah nad hlavou? Dobry drist.English: <Wordwrap>Qahwah over head? What prattle. I fear this wretch has naught more to offer. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Vskutku skvelé. S heslom sa ľa.English: <Wordwrap>Indeed. With the password, we may infiltrate their ranks and learn their plans. 'Tis a dangeorous plan. My poor heart. Let us play the calming game of seven I wilt send Pištík off. \n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Si zošalel, Pištíka? Šak ten z.English: <Wordwrap>Art ye mad? Pištík? That bumbkin can‘t find a way out of his britches, ‚tis us who shall be off to investigate. \n<Pavol>

\"Qahwah nad hlavou\" Tak to vravel ten.English: <Wordwrap>Just remind me of the password. "Qahwah over head" Thus spoke the poor soul. \n<Jozef>

Už ste vysliedili kultistu? \\n<Jozef>.English: Hath you tracked down the cultist? \n<Jozef>

No! Barátok moji, tu ste konečne. \\n<Jo.English: Aye! Barátok, here you are at last. \n<Jozef>

Sme pipa v lese hledali, ale to škoda re.English:
We were a-hunting for the priest in the forest, but that tale must wait.
The Jew, however, imparted some useful knowledge; he spake of the cultists' garb bedecked with vampire teeth. Encountering one, ye shalt know them at once. \n

<Wordwrap>Markantné. Dobre teda, dám ved.English: <Wordwrap>Noteworthy. Very well then, I shall apprise the castle garrison to be wary of such ilk.\n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Už sa po okolí predpokladám ce.English: <Wordwrap>You seem to be quite versed in the lay of the land now. Try Seek out some cultists... \n<Jozef>

Heslo viete už, tak choďte chytro tam.\\.English: You know the password, be off. \n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Sluchaj! Sme ziscili heslo od.English:
<Wordwrap>Listen! We know the password to their outpost. They gather in the fortress in the west of the valley. "Qahwah over head", or something like that!
\n<Pavol>

Obed bol už. Kej si hladny, musiš vytrim.English: <WordWrap>The midday meal hath passed. If thou art hungry, thou must fend for thyself.\n<Servant>

V pivnici by mohli byc. Skus na pec pozr.English: They may be in the cellar. Try looking on the oven. \n<Servant>

Išol do pivnici. Šak kukaj tu, po zemi v.English: <WordWrap>Went into the cellar he did. Look at all this mess he left behind.\n<Servant>

<Wordwrap>Zemepan zaš na mäso dostal chu.English: <WordWrap>The lord hath developed a fervor for meat. 'Tis meat, meat, meat incessantly. Halušky don't please him, he just picks the bacon out of them.\n<Servant>

Neška perši raz za paru tyždne zemepan c.English: <WordWrap>For the first time in weeks, milord wanted to lent. I had cakes prepared, had to give them to the guards, lest they go waste.\n<Servant>

Zemepan taky dobry vždy bol na mňa. Furt.English: <WordWrap>Milord was always good to me. Oh, he'd praise me for every meal.\n<Servant>

Fuh, Pali, radšej sem nechoď.\\n<Matej>.English: Oh. Pali, Thou better not see this.\n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Počuvaj, Jožku. Bol som u kult.English: <Wordwrap>Hark, Jožko. I ventured amongst the cultists and faced their leader. Though another may hold sway above him, the name 'Root' ye kept mentioning. \n<Pavol>

No a ako to prebiehalo? Nenapínaj ma.\\n.English: And how did it unfold? Do not keep me in suspense. \n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Som mu nadristal glupociny upl.English: <Wordwrap>I wove a tapestry of sheer absurdity, painting Matej as a heretic and the like. It seems he took the bait. Yet, I cannot fathom for how long. He promptly assigned me the grim task of dispatching a certain Bohdan, promising entry into their ranks. \n<Pavol>

Hmmm, tak čo ďalej? Asi toho kultistu by.English: <WordWrap>Hmm, what lies ahead? Mayhaps we should seek out this cultist. \n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Počekaj, to ne je šecko. Ne si.English: <Wordwrap>But hold, there's more. Ye art not the sole keeper of the secrets beneath the castle. Those fools hath their own labyrinth beneath our feet. One can access it through a humble lumberjack's abode. I hath secured the passage, that hath been barred. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Nádhera! Zaútočíme na nich! Pr.English: <Wordwrap>Excellent! We shall assail them! However, it would be prudent to locate Bohdan first. If the cult seeks his silence, he undoubtedly harbors vital knowledge. \n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Kult kejc ho chce zahlušic, ta.English: <Wordwrap>Should the cult move to silence him, he holds secrets of grave import. I shall swiftly seek him out. Ignác hinted he might be within the church walls.\n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Inač v dzedzine som zatiaľ obj.English: <WordWrap>Also, I found a faimly whose daughter joined a cult. Only she got lost, not before she wrote everything down in her diary. Might be useful I reckon.\n<Pavol>

V sude si \\c[14]zakysaného mlieka\\c[0].English: You found \c[14]sour cream\c[0] in the barrel.

V sude si objavil \\c[14]fľašku alpy\\c[.English: A flask of \c[14]alpa\c[0] was found among the contents of this barrel.

No nazdar, chlapi, jak pokračuje investi.English: Greetings, lads, how fares the investigation? \n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Sme še infiltrovali ku kultist.English: <Wordwrap>We hath ventured into the midst of the cultists. Yet, to gain audience with their leader, we must present them with some painting hidden within thy chamber. \n<Pavol>

No, chlapi moji… heh… ta keď ja sa troch.English: <WordWrap>Well, my lads... heh... I confess a tinge of shame, but I shall reveal it unto you... \n<Jozef>

No i tak neviem, ako by ste to zobrali,.English: <WordWrap>I'm unsure how are you to take it, behold, 'tis a fresco adorning the wall! \n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Šumne, Jožku, bars šumne. No t.English: <Wordwrap>Thing of beauty, Jožko, truly. Such heathens know naught yet to revel in scandalous imagery. Ye art as easily put in mood as rabbits. Just give us any engraving and all will be well. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Tak ale srdce mi puká, keď vám.English: <Wordwrap>Yet, my heart doth ache as I relinquish such a rarity. 'Tis brought me many a moment of joy. To ease my sorrow, go forth and arrange matters thyself, whilst I engage in a game of chess with brother Matej. I cannot bear the ignominy of defeat... With the white pieces, victory is assured. \n<Jozef>

Bez zemepána to strašný život bude.\\n<Ď.English: Twill be a terrible life without milord. \n<Ďusi>

Nechcem vedieť, čo by sa stalo, kebyže n.English: <WordWrap>I don't want to know what would happen if at least you didn't arrive on time.\n<Ďusi>

Chudák, isto sa dal naverbovať mysliac s.English: Poor fellow, he certainly got recruited thinking that he would drive the Hussites out of his homeland.

Keby dal na slová svojej matere, neležal.English: Had he listened to his mother, maybe he'd still be alive now.

<Wordwrap>Pozri naňho, bedáka. S kultist.English: <WordWrap>Look upon yon poor soul. Mayhap he wished not to consort with the fiends of the cult, hence they did seek to sway him by cunning persuasion.\n<Matej>

Vypatra to, že nazor nakoniec zmenil.\\n.English: <WordWrap>I'm afraid he had to change his opinion.\n<Pavol>

Chudák akýsi tu leží. Dedinčan asi..English: <WordWrap>Poor soul lies here. A villager most likely.

Maceju! Jak rad ce vidzim, ani neznaš!\\.English: Matej! 'Tis a joy to see ye, even if ye knowest not how much! \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Dobre, páni. Konečne máme troc.English: <Wordwrap>Very well, gentlemen. Finally, we hath a moment's respite. Quickly, explain to me what is happening here. \n<Adam>

Hej, si medzitym možme konečne haby nasp.English: Aye, in the meantime, we can exchange back our garments. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Ta tak... Najprv som sem prišo.English: <Wordwrap>Well then... I arrived here in the midst of summer in search of my wife, and Macej was already here, studying some illuminated manuscript about the Israelites. \n<Pavol>

Nie, Pali, ja som privandroval až po teb.English: Nay, Pali, I arrived after thee. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>No to jedno. Ja som pil veľo v.English: <Wordwrap>That matters not. I drank much in my chamber when I noticed how the old castle began to burn. So the lord sent us yonder with Matej, and we found the Turk dead and the cursed qahwah... \n<Pavol>

A takú sféru s kľukou na točenie...\\n<M.English: And such a sphere with handle for rotating... \n<Matej>

...no a tak me manželka dobodala. Potom.English: … so my wife hath stabbed me. Then ye found me. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Nuž. Existuje nejaký plán star.English: <Wordwrap>Indeed. Doth anyone possess knowledge of an alternative route into yon dungeon within the old castle? \n<Adam>

Mienim, že to sa musíme spýtať zemepána..English: Methinks we should inquire of the lord about this matter. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>A hátad legyen elöl! A dér mar.English: <Wordwrap>A hátad legyen elöl! A dér marjon meg!  Whilst you hast dallied here with but a few cultists, an army of them hath besieged the village! So spoke the messenger who fled thence, running as if driven mad. \n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Aha, hmmm... a ako sa dá dosta.English: <Wordwrap>Ah, hmm... and how might we gain access to the dungeon of the old castle? We require another path, for these two do inform me that the usual entrance is enchanted. \n<Adam>

<Wordwrap>Vy ste sa zbláznili, všetci tr.English: <WordWrap>You hath all lost your wits, standing thus. Can you not hear that the entire village is under siege? \n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Nikto nezošalel, ukľudni sa Jo.English: <Wordwrap>None hath lost their wits, calm thyself, Jozef. Focus and recall how we may reach that dungeon. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Eeeeeh... no... ale tak to by.English: <Wordwrap>Eeeeeh... well... it would seem thou must needs take flight, perchance. We must surmount the lofty wall to reach the other side. \n<Jozef>

Ideme za židom.\\n<Adam>.English: Let us seek out the Jew. \n<Adam>

Si nečul, Jožku? Nemame času teraz.\\n<P.English: Hearest ye not, Jožku? We hath scant time to tarry now. \n<Pavol>

To ťažko povedať. Ale je to len malí hra.English: Hard to say, but it's just a small castle. Tower and main building, nothing more. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Aha, hmmm... akoby sme sa mohl.English: <Wordwrap>Hmmm. How could we reach the dungeon of the old castle by an alternative route? \n<Adam>

<Wordwrap>No ak by sme vedeli lietať, ľa.English: <Wordwrap>Verily, if we possessed the power of flight, we could swiftly enter. Behold, the flames consumed the entirety of the roof. \n<Matej>

Uvidíš. Mám plán.\\n<Adam>.English: You'll see. I have a plan.\n<Adam>

<Wordwrap>Páni! Strašná novina, na obec.English: <Wordwrap>Men! Terrible news, cultists attacked the village. Perhaps an army of cultists! The messenger came running like mad.\n<Ďusi>

Hmmm... Náš plán to nemení. Budeme sa k.English: <WordWrap>Hmmm... Our plan doesn't change. We will have to fight our way to the Jew.\n<Adam>

No čo, richtár už je v bezpečí?\\n<Valér.English:
Well, is the burgmaster safe already?
\n<Valér>

<Wordwrap>Našťastie áno, ale bol to tvrd.English:
<Wordwrap>Fortunately, yes, but it was a hard fight. Thou didst not deceive us; thou are now free.
\n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>No áno, ale čo ja tuto teraz z.English: <Wordwrap>Well, yes, but what can I achieve here, at burgmaster's right I would have been more helpful... oh, to hell with you... get out of my way.\n<Valér>

<Wordwrap>Šekaj ešči... sme s cebu nesko.English:
<Wordwrap>Wait a moment... we haven't finished yet. We need to talk about this qahwah business of yers.
\n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Čo ešte chcete vedieť? Plány s.English:
<Wordwrap>What else do you want to know? We had big plans, everyone enjoys it, and we even suspect it causes a certain addiction.
\n<Valér>

<Wordwrap>A ty ši co vlastne zač, jak si.English:
<Wordwrap>And what about ye? What exactly do ye do, how did ye get into such businesses?
\n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Som syn hradného šaša, slúžil.English:
<Wordwrap>I am the son of the court jester, I served at the court of Albrecht II. After the death of his wife Elizabeth, we remained on the side of Ladislav Pohrobok... but that cursed uncle Friedrich has been holding him hostage for nine years now, I escaped from there.
\n<Valér>

<Wordwrap>Richtár je tiež na našej stran.English:
<Wordwrap>The Reeve is also on our side and offered me refuge. In forty-four, that foolish Pole Vladislav III. didn't heed Hunyadi - the White Knight - and bravely charged at the janissaries, and perished...
\n<Valér>

<Wordwrap>Hej, šak som to vidzel na vlas.English:
<Wordwrap>Aye, I saw it with my own eyes. Hunyadi knew it was foolishness.
\n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Nuž, oslavovali sme uznanie La.English:
<Wordwrap>Well, we celebrated Ladislav's recognition as the rightful king, but still... all our efforts to release Ladislav were in vain...
\n<Valér>

<Wordwrap>Turecký vpád narušil richtárov.English:
<Wordwrap>The Turkish invasion disrupted the Reeve's trade with the lowlands, and we were seeking some economic alternative; qahwah business started to pick up quite well. And now, step aside, I will go.
\n<Valér>

<Wordwrap>A kam chceš ísť, veď určite ma.English:
<Wordwrap>And where dost thou intend to go? Surely the occultists had plans to carve thou up as well. The lord will surely offer thou refuge until things settle down.
\n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Pokecame potem. Teraz musim ka.English:
<Wordwrap>We will talk later. I must find me friend.
\n<Pavol>

Do zámku pasoval kľúč od strážnika!\nNaš.English:

...No, ale, ďakujem ti. Tuhľa, dajte si.English: <WordWrap>...Well, thank you anyway. Here, take this moonshine, my godfather would enjoy it with you.\n<Damsel>

Keby sce stretli dajakeho husitu, ta ho.English:
If you meet any Hussites, drive tham away!

Husitov márujte kľudne naďalej. Akorát t.English: <WordWrap>Feel free to continue hunting the Hussites. Just bring me no more of their ears.\n<Damsel>

\\c[14]Delobuch\\c[0] sa tu povaľuje! Te.English: A \c[14]petard\c[0]! You shall make use of it.

Ničoho tu niet. Dokonale to tu niekto vy.English: Nothing remains here. Someone pillaged this house.

Div že tu skriňu nechal ten, kto to tu v.English: A wonder that this wardrobe was left here by the one who pillaged this place.

Nehal tu kultista \\c[14]arkebuzu\\c[0]..English: A cultist left an \c[14]arquebus\c[0] here. Powder and bullets, everything is here.

Dobré ráno. Za Adamom idete? \\n<Stráž>.English: Good morrow. Are thee bound for Adam's abode\n<Guardsman>

Ano, list mu nesiem, doležity. \\n<Zbroj.English: Aye, bearing a missive of weight, meant for his eyes alone. \n<Man at arms>

Dobre poďte, dnu. Adam pracuje pri stole.English: Proceed then, within. Adam tends to his affairs at his table. \n<Guardsman>

<Wordwrap>Zdar! Nesiem ti list doležity.English: <Wordwrap>Hail! I bear a missive of import from Lord Jozef. I arrived in Kassau last eve but could not locate thee, spending two hours in search. \n<Man at arms>

<Wordwrap>By to mohlo byc otravene abo c.English: <Wordwrap>It may be poisoned or worse. Perhaps we should test it on a rabbit first and see what happens... But we believe we already know. The same as Janči. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Treba skusiť, ale hej… ľudia n.English: <Wordwrap>'Tis  worth a try, but aye... the people hath vanished. We thought the Hussites had slain them, but then some of the youth joined a strange cult. \n<Priest>

<Wordwrap>Od takeho maleho chlopa Valera.English: <Wordwrap>From a small lad named Valer, he is my supplier. He disguises himself in a black cloak... but everyone knows there is only one dwarf in the village, dwelling in that half-timbered house. \n<Priest>

<Wordwrap>Ta ja som znala, že naš valaľ.English: <Wordwrap>I knew that our town was in danger. But I thought the Hussites would try to ransack us, not our offspring! I can only pray to God. \n<Elder>

<Wordwrap>Nič to, tak teba poverujem, má.English: <Wordwrap>No matter, I place my trust in thee; thou hast authority herein. Arm yourselves; the weapons lie below, beneath the church. We take our leave. \n<Adam>
<Wordwrap>No matter, I place my trust in thee; thou hast authority herein. Seek sanctuary in the rectory. We take our leave. \n<Adam>

<Wordwrap>Rýchlo! Už o hodinu sa chystaj.English: <Wordwrap>Haste! In but an hour, they plan to murder the lord! They grew furious upon learning that Ignác is dead! I must return swiftly ere they notice I am gone! \n<Anička>

<Wordwrap>Počkaj, kľud. Akože zamordovať.English: <Wordwrap>Hold, calm thyself. How would they murder the lord? There are so many guards and an arsenal so vast that even the army of Murad would struggle to besiege the castle. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Budzeme tam. Ich prekvapime. L.English: <Wordwrap>We shall be there. We shall surprise them. Just stay back in the fray, lest a stray blade find ye. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Snaď tam pobudnu dlhšie do več.English: <Wordwrap>Perhaps they will linger until evening. Might hath canceled the meeting upon learning that Ignác has met his end. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>To počka. Jožku, zamykaj oblak.English: <Wordwrap>That shall wait for now. Jožef, lock the window. An assassination attempt on the ye is imminent. They plan to climb through Matej's window like ants. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Aszt a hét kibaszott fejű sárk.English: <Wordwrap><Wordwrap>Aszt a hét kibaszott fejű sárkány faszát baszná meg a rohadt disznó! Az ángyod térdét néki már! <Wordwrap>Máme taktickú výhodu, budú loz.English: <Wordwrap>Verily, we hold a strategic edge; they shall ascend one by one, intending to convene in the chapel afore the deed of assassination. Yet, we ought not to launch our assault forthwith. 'Twould be most prudent to divide their company in twain, with your men attending to the half that endeavors to flee downstairs.\n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>A zemepan, daj šebe pozor na A.English: <Wordwrap>And Lord, keep an eye on Anička. A young girl there shall be, she is our informant among the cultists. Let us hide in the chapel. The battle will commence with a shot, which wilt terrify them utterly, as they will be creeping like mice. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Pali, Pali, ale ti vravím, že.English: <Wordwrap>Pali, Pali, I tell thee, thy only recourse is complete abstinence, for thou art truly a devotee of the drink. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Ale šak tam nejdzeme pic, info.English: <Wordwrap>But we shall not partake of spirits, we must gather information. 'Tis Root we seek, not libations. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Hej, aľe ta šak co tam vof kar.English: <Wordwrap>Aye, and shall we play Pexeso in the tavern? They shall regard us as fools! No time for petiness here, we are prying into the matters of importance! \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Pexeso…? Ja to beriem ako moju.English: <Wordwrap>Pexeso...? I consider it my missionary endeavor, by God's grace, even if it were the last thing I do. I shall make an abstainer of thee. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Ta veľo ščesca a hlavne to teľ.English: <Wordwrap>May ye hath plenty of luck in ye endeavour. What prey tell shall we do stead drink.. we shanot sit there as two Mujahideen! \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Boh ochraňuj moju spásu, sprav.English: <Wordwrap>May the Lord protect my salvation, we shall do it thus... we shall exchange cloaks, and I shall drink in thy stead. 'Twill appear normal, for thee, as a monk, to abstain. But thou must continue to chide me, so we may depart without drawing attention. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Heh, no cij panabeka, ta toto.English: <Wordwrap>Heh, well said, this doth please me! Perhaps imbibing shall benefit thee, mayhap it shall calm thy spirit. \n<Pavol>

Slivovicu a henten len žinčicu, on iba o.English: <Wordwrap>Slivovitza for me, and žinčitza for him, for he doth prefer the sacramental wine. \n<Matej>

\n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Pane, ta toto še mi bars ľubel.English: <Wordwrap>Sir, I commend ye for thy fortitude in quelling my squire's excesses. 'Twas he who was charged to escort me. <Wordwrap>Naj ci služi zdravie! Co ty vo.English: <Wordwrap>Very well, may ye health be kept! Pray, sir, what is thy name? Ye countenance is unfamiliar to mine eyes. I am... Matej, at ye service. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Nazdravie, Maceju. Škoda reči..English: <Wordwrap>Hail, Matej. 'Tis a pity. Here I buy some, there I sell some. You know how it goes, always something amiss. They call me Marek. And how didst thou come upon this place? \n<Marek>

Jaj... ja som pravoslavny.\n\\n<Pavol>.English: Oh... I am of the Orthodox faith. \n<Pavol>

Nečul som o takej. No a jak, že ci ušla,.English: I hath not heard of such. But how doth she flee, or some such? \n<Marek>

<Wordwrap>Ta som bul vof Kosove robic po.English: <Wordwrap>I was in Kosovo as a military chaplain and there I nearly lost my life. Then I drowned my sorrows for two years. That she leaves me and hopes I shall find solace in God. \n<Pavol>

Boha s tym! Naľej si, nazdravie! Jak vob.English: <Wordwrap>God with it! Pour for thyself, cheers! How dost thou even know she shall be here? \n<Marek>

<Wordwrap>Ta sem chodzila jedine; za šes.English: <Wordwrap>Verily, she used to frequent this place solely; accompanied by her cousin. When her deceit was not upon me. Yet, I also encountered her but the day ere yesterday. \n<Pavol>

Sure, go away now.
Marečku, let us imbibe once more. The šlivovica though passable, pales in comparison to that concocted by my grandsire. Should we partake of that, we would both have been laid to rest. \n

<Wordwrap>Ta to vof jakym klaštore ši še.English: <Wordwrap>Where didst thou acquire such a capacity for drink within the cloisters, hmm! Methought thou wouldst succumb forthwith. \n<Marek>

<Wordwrap>A co ši šebe myslel že co my v.English: <Wordwrap>What didst ye reckon we pondered whilst gazing upon the holy images in seminary? None possesses the art of plum fermentation better than the venerable Brother Arpád. We brethren hold that even fermentation is the handiwork of God. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Ci pana, Maceju, ta to musim š.English: By God, Matej, I must pay thee a visit one day, hmm! Whither am I bound? \n<Marek>

<Wordwrap>Vof Debreczéne, to zbadaš tako.English: <Wordwrap>In Debreczén, ye shalt discern naught but level terrain. But divulge, whence dost ye hail and what purpose dost ye pursue herein? \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Ja som ľen taky potulny rytier.English: <Wordwrap>I am but a wandering knight from Eperjes, in the employ of a Turk known as Root. For he is a stranger to these lands, he tasked me with seeking out merchants for such beans. 'Tis a profitable affair, indeed. Huh! \n<Marek>

<Wordwrap>Qahwah myšliš? Ta to neznaš co.English: <Wordwrap>Dost ye refer to Qahwah? Art thou knowledgeable of that old castle? We ventured thither to witness its conflagration and chanced upon some beans therein. \n<Pavol>

Získal si mešec s \\c[14]50 korunami\\c[.English: You gained a pouch with \c[14]50 coins\c[0].

<Wordwrap>Ta mne še coška doneslo do slu.English: <Wordwrap>Verily, something brought to my attention that the priest roasted those grains himself. 'Tis rather peculiar, indeed. Yet, I hath had my fill; I shall retire now, thou art the victor. \n<Marek>

Fuj... tak toto bolo dúfam naposledy. \\.English: Ohh. Hope that was the last time I flew.\n<Adam>

Musime teho Kor a Mar najsc.\\n<Pavol>.English: Verily, we must seek out this Rot and Mar. \n<Pavol>

Zásielka došla? Koľko mutantov ste vyrob.English: Hath the shipment arrived? How many mutants hast thou forged? \n<Turk>

Došla. Za tento týždeň šesť. Zatiaľ všet.English: <Wordwrap>Verily, the shipment hath reached our hands. Six mutants hath been crafted within this week. All proceedeth according to the grand design. \n<Marek>

<Wordwrap>Ahrimana v starom hrade už mát.English: <Wordwrap>And hath Ahriman been brought under sway within the old castle? Since his hand hath kindled the inferno, all are in a state of agitation. The burgmaster hath severed his bonds with us; we were compelled to take action against him. Furthermore, that knight of the lord doth meddle here, thrusting his nose into every matter. 'Tis a boon that the operation is already set in motion. \n<Turk>

<Wordwrap>Hej, Pauline zakliatie drží Ah.English: <Wordwrap>Yea, Pauline's enchantment doth bind Ahriman. He must needs obey our every command. Yet Pauline doth assert that this bond may not endure much longer; the eternal flame holdeth great power. Nevertheless, with the aid of Zurvanistic sorcery, we shall soon penetrate the depths to the infernal blaze and shalt no longer require his service. \n<Marek>

<Wordwrap>Chvála Allahovi. V mene sultán.English: <Wordwrap>Praised be Allah. In the name of the sultan, take these 100 gold coins and deliver them unto Pauline. Is the plan set forth this day ready? \n<Turk>

<Wordwrap>Nie, uskutoční sa zanedlho. O.English: <Wordwrap>Indeed, all is prepared. We shalt strike ere the dawn breaks. I hold reservations regarding that monk; he doth arouse suspicion. But Pauline hath made it clear that only the removal of the knight is warranted. \n<Marek>

Tak spravte ako rozkázala, má sultánovu.English: Then execute as commanded; she hath the trust of the sultan. Ma'a salama. \n<Turk>

Chlape, pašak jesteš pašak! Ja by jsem ť.English: <Wordwrap>Verily, thou art a true drunkard! Though I may surpass thee in drink, yet I acknowledge thy prowess.\n<Mercenary>

Fuh, nabuduce možeme sa pretekac chlope..English: Aye, next time we may engage in drinking game, friend. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Nejsu sprosté, vidim že jakési.English: <Wordwrap>Fear not, I am no simpleton; I perceive that some rather peculiar individuals are present here. My loyalty lies with thee, brother. \n<Mercenary>

<Wordwrap>Ta zahrajme šebe potom hod sek.English: <Wordwrap>Let us then test our skill with the axe and target! But for now, I must attend to some matters with Macej... \n<Pavol>

Maceju, Maceju špiš? Coška še idze robic.English: <Wordwrap>Macej, Macej, art ye asleep? What business art ye to undertake so early on this day? \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Ppali... aj tys s kultistami?.English: <Wordwrap>P-pali... art thou also with the cultists? Mhhhhammm...uff. Thou, a cultist... I shall... I shall deal with thee. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Neeee... Mac hek! Maceju, sluc.English: <Wordwrap>Nayyy... Mat.., hic! Matej, heed my words... I shall just rest my head here for a moment... but wake me immediately... dost ye understand? \n<Pavol>

Fuj do Boha… co som to porobil zas. Ci p.English: <Wordwrap>Alas, what transgression hath I wrought again? By the grace of the Almighty... my bladder is full and my mouth is parched. \n<Pavol>

Zdar! Nikto nevedel tak prevážať človeka.English: <WordWrap>Hail! None knew how to ferry a man across Torysa as well as another man, that is, I.\n<Pisshead>

Serus, ja som Pali. A co tu robiš, šak T.English: <WordWrap>Hey there, I am Pali. And what art ye doing here, Torysa is far, hath ye run aground or what?\n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Nevypýtaj sa ani! Mojej loďku.English: <WordWrap>Ask not! My boat, the tallest mast, I've been far and wide refitting it, ill-fated it turned out. One day a lightning struck the mast, somehow or other, well, something happened there, and it caught fire. As the captain, I leaped first and swam ashore, thinking to seek aid. And there, men were throwing themselves into the water with women and children as if they were dumb.\n<Pisshead>

<Wordwrap>Veď nehorela až tak loďka a ja.English: <WordWrap>Yet the boat did not burn that much, and I already shouted to them, bidding them to patiently wait, for it's not burning. Well, it is burning, but not that much. Yet they swam somehow and clung to me angrily, but I told them, well, how else was I to do it except as I did. The boat burnt, down the current and I hung up my captaining. \n<Pisshead>

Boh naj nas chrani, žeby taki jak ty bol.English: God save us, would that there were more like ye at the helm.\n<Pavol>

To co ma byc? Me nechceš puscic? Ti pris.English: What's this? Wilt thou not release me? Shall I ruffle thee?\n<Pavol>

Mincu do mňa nedáš? Obracať mincu budem.English: <WordWrap>Will you not put a coin into me? I will flip it as if it was mine to flip.\n<Pisshead>

<Wordwrap>Nie si garanciou toho, čo som.English: <WordWrap>Thou art not a guarantee of what I am, that when I say I'll give the coin and have none, I'll still give it, thou hast none, thou shalt not give it.\n<Pisshead>

<Wordwrap>Ľutovať raz darmo by bolo nebo.English: <WordWrap>To regret once would be in vain, what's done cannot be undone. Therefore I say from the beginning, one must make their own closure. By the power of thy coin, I shall perhaps purchase for myself a new raft one day and be as one. \n<Pisshead>

<Wordwrap>Preto som šiel sem, aby do mňa.English: <WordWrap>Thus I came here, so that a coin would come into me. Even with such an amount, it may happen that we can start doing things, but we mustn't let ourselves be taken in. \n<Pisshead>

<Wordwrap>Chcel som povedať, že ty, teda.English: <WordWrap>I wanted to say, that thou, I mean I wanted to use another name, but the greatest size is thy heart. It suits to rule like a lord but thee also aid thus. \n<Pisshead>

<Wordwrap>Pre lásku Božiu, Pali, prestaň.English: <WordWrap>In the name of the Lord, Pali, stop talking to this rascal! And thou, captain, begone from my sight forever.\n<Matej>

Zmizni, ty gauner! Keby si radšej zostal.English: <WordWrap>Begone, thou scoundrel! Wouldst thou rather have stayed on thy raft!\n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Ja som plavieviaval na toryse.English: <Wordwrap>I swam on the right to the left. The left was dense at the time she was still living. I am in the cabin sitting at a sharp angled table. I deserve the rank, but they're sinking my ship-\^  \n<Pisshead>

Všetko je životná skúsenosť, životná skú.English: Everything is a life experience, a life test. That, I learned a lot of things. \n<Pisshead>

Rános nenašol žádné slipy?\\n<Žoldnier>.English: Didst thou find any undergarments this morning? \n<Mercenary>

Hahá! Bratku, vidím, že ti život naložil.English: <Wordwrap>Haha! Brother, I see life hath dealt thee a blow! Here, take a few coins. \n<Mercenary>

Há, už si pamatám. V Kosove sem te videu.English: Oh, I remember now. In Kosovo, saw you slash a Turks forehead.\n<Mercenary>

Aleba? Ta to podiškurujeme potom.\\n<Pav.English: Is that so? We may discourse later.\n<Pavol>

Ta veľo šcesce chlopi. Žeby sce totych l.English: <Wordwrap>May fortune smile upon thee, my lads. Would that ye could find those scoundrels. \n<Innkeeper>

To škoda reči. Nas odžubali zlodeji ta i.English: <Wordwrap>Tis a lamentable tale. We hath been robbed by thieves, and now we seek them. \n<Pavol>

Jaajh bidaci. Tu mate aspoň kus vinka.\\.English: Oh, poor souls. Here, at least, hath a bit of wine. \n<Inkeeper>

Krčmár ti daroval \\c[14]tri fľašky vínk.English: The innkeeper have gifted you \c[14]three bottles of wine\c[0]. \n<Innkeeper>

<Wordwrap>Šak ho zober do kostola naj še.English: <WordWrap>Take him to the church and return swiftly, we shall converse. 'Tis improper to vex a clergyman. Today it is full here, for yesterday the town was closed. Burgmaster was afraid of the Hussites. They torched the old castle.\n<Innkeeper>

<Wordwrap>Šak ho zober do hradu a še vra.English: <WordWrap>Take him to the castle and return swiftly, we shall converse. 'Tis improper to vex a clergyman. Today we're empty, town is closed, the burgmaster fears an attack by the Hussites.\n<Innkeeper>

<Wordwrap>Naj ci šmakuje! Dneška tu plno.English: <WordWrap>To your health! Today it is full here, for yesterday the town was closed. Burgmaster was afraid of the Hussites. They torched the old castle.\n<Innkeeper>

<Wordwrap>Naj ci šmakuje! Dneška tu praz.English: <WordWrap>To your health! Today we're empty, town is closed, the burgmaster fears an attack by the Hussites.\n<Innkeeper>

Neznam, či husiti to zapalili. Ale hej,.English: <WordWrap>I doubt 'twas Hussites who set it ablaze. But aye, I shall take him away.\n<Pavol>

Hej, dobre, idzem ho dac spinkac.\\n<Pav.English: Indeed, very well, I shall let the clergyman rest.\n<Pavol>

Neznam, či husiti to zapalili. Fajne pif.English: <WordWrap>I doubt 'twas Hussites who set it ablaze. Good brew, I shall come again sometime.\n<Pavol>

Fajne pifko, dojdzem zaš dakedy.\\n<Pavo.English: Good brew, I shall come again sometime.\n<Pavol>

Počkaj ešte, dačo dobreho nechceš kupiť?.English: Wait, wouldst thou not wish to purchase something of quality?\n<Innkeeper>

<Wordwrap>Som počul, že vraj žida husiti.English: <WordWrap>Heard Hussites raided a Jew. Doesn't live in the town, guards couldn't protect him. Treated him badly, they say.<WordWrap>\n<Innkeeper>

<Wordwrap>A ešči vraj dajaky lupiči priv.English: <WordWrap>Also they say some thieves came to this domain. Do no look at me as if I was dull, I know that stealing is the most common crime anywhere. But this bunch is truly brave. Will come into your house and rob you in the light of day! And before you know it, they are gone...\n<Innkeeper>

Dobre si čul. Nabehli mu do domu a richt.English: <WordWrap>You have heard the truth. Marched into his abode they did, and burgmaster did not lift a finger to help himn<Pavol>

Ta už nemam čo. Ale šak dojdi zajtra, mo.English: <WordWrap>Alas, I have nought else. But come again tomorrow, perchance some gossip may arise.\n<Innkeeper>

Jakého proviantu sa ti zažiada, ja ti pr.English: <WordWrap>For a price I'll give anything you wish for!\n<Innkeeper>

<Wordwrap>Som počul, že vraj žida husiti.English: <WordWrap>Heard Hussites raided a Jew. Doesn't live in the town, guards couldn't protect him. Treated him badly, they say.<WordWrap>\n<Innkeeper>

Ta už nemam čo. Ale dojdi zajtra šak, mo.English: <WordWrap>Alas, I have nought else. But come again tomorrow, perchance some gossip may arise.\n<Innkeeper>

Ájh, pán zemepán, nech ti žehná pán Boh!.English: <WordWrap>My leige! God bless you! Please accept this \c[14]wine\c[0], on behalf of the business.\n<Innkeeper>

Ta som čul, že husiti pri vode dakoho z.English: Heard that the Hussites began to torturing people by the water in the morning.\n<Innkeeper>

<Wordwrap>No veru. Žid vraj najal päťdes.English: <Wordwrap>That's right. Heard the Jew hired fifty Poles and they drove the Hussites out of his house. \n<Innkeeper>

No... Akože... To som počul už. Daco inš.English: I... ugh... heard that one. Tell us something different.\n<Pavol>

Ta ešči som čul, že husiti pri vode dako.English: <WordWrap>Well, also heard that the Hussites began to torturing people by the water in the morning.\n<Innkeeper>

No veru. Žid vraj najal päťdesiat poliak.English: <Wordwrap>That's right. Heard the Jew hired fifty Poles and they drove the Hussites out of his house.\n<Innkeeper>

<Wordwrap>Som čul, že sa dačo porobelo v.English: <Wordwrap>It is said something took place in the fort in the west! Someone said they saw Feri there as well!\n<Innkeeper>

<Wordwrap>A co ja som s tebu kravy pasol.English: <WordWrap>Hath we tended cattle together? I have tasks aplenty, bother me not, for I must spread dung till evening lest my wife unleash her wrath upon me. Oh, would the devil smite her! She vexes me so, she ought to be tamed somehow, perhaps given a draught for calming, for ever since our son left, I cannot endure her.\n<Farmer>

Furt po mne ľem vrešti, jak by ja som bu.English: <WordWrap>The hag keeps hollering at me, as if I were guilty of all sins.\n<Farmer>

<Wordwrap>Ten poodniaty husita Jiskra si.English: <Wordwrap>The damned Hussite Jiskra is conquering the upper lands like some Mongol, as if the Turks were not enough for us. I knew the fool who opened the gate to him in the Spiš Castle, he's already under the ground! Jiskra has Bratislava, Košice and Levoča under his thumb! They don't fancy each other with Hunyady very much, I tell you, there will be more fun here!\n<Peasant>

Nikdaj nič dobre nebude nikde.\\n<Nešťas.English: <WordWrap>Everything will be horrid forever everywhere.\n<Miserable man>

<Wordwrap>Kym toten Jiskra z Čechoch bud.English: <Wordwrap>While the Jiskra from Bohemia stays in Spiš, there will be no peace.\n<Miserable man>

Navždy bude šecko zle všade.\\n<Nešťastn.English: <WordWrap>Nothing will ever be good anywhere.\n<Miserable man>

<Wordwrap>Každu noc še budzim spoceny, š.English: <Wordwrap>Every night I wake up sweaty, dreaming that the Hussites are chopping me up.\n<Miserable man>

V pohodze ši, Maceju? Drychmaj drychmaj..English: Are you alright, Matej? Sleep, sleep. \n<Pavol>

Ta co? Krava sa ti zdurila?\\n<Pavol>.English: <WordWrap>Prey tell? Hath ye cow gone mad?\n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Ale nee, horše daco. Caly rok.English: <WordWrap>Nay, worse it be. For a whole year I gathered planks, to build a bridge beyond the village. Yet someone did covet those planks. The bridge dismantled, and who knoweth what fate befell it.\n\n<Woodworker>

Desky su naspak tam, dze boli. Akorat mo.English: <WordWrap>The boards are back at the cliffside. You just have to reassemble the bridge.\n<Pavol>

Nadhera! Idzem takoj tam, most do hodzin.English: <WordWrap>Wonderful! I'm going there at once, in an hour the bridge shall stand anew!\n<Woodworker>

Ajh hľah. Ktos... kto si? Poznáme sa? Sm.English: Mmnhg... Ay, Ye... Who are ye? Do I know ye?\n<Drunkard>

Hľeh- Ryh! Jojh. Vobec, som ťa... nikdy.English: Hngh-Gulp! Oi, never have... have I see you... ever.\n<Drunkard>

Len rypem. Praženica ešči nevychladla, d.English: Only a jest. The porridge hath not yet cooled, partake. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Tak čo podnikneme najprv? Odch.English: <Wordwrap>So, what shall we undertake first? Shall we apprehend some cultist? Thanks to the guidance of the Jew, we can now easily recognize them. Or shall we seek Valer? \n<Matej>

Co ja znam? Poc še najesc v kľudze. Daco.English: <Wordwrap>I doth not know. Let us break our fast in peace. We shall devise a plan thereafter. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Sce čuli? Zemepan vraj nič pre.English: <Wordwrap>Have you heard? The lord will not move a finger to help this land. My granny told me, that he only visits bathouses outside the region.\n<Zbrojnoš>

Kašli na truľka. Sa nebudzeš jedovac kol.English: <WordWrap>Forget him, you do not want to poison yourself with anger over him, do you? \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Môžem ťa pozvať? Veď slnko už.English: <Wordwrap>Verily, may I extend thee an invitation? For the sun doth now set. Innkeeper, bring forth two more Slivovitz for us! 'Tis a surprise to behold thee here, for Hungary doth wage war against the Turks. How dost thou manage to dwell here amidst these times? \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Smutný príbeh Turka jest, manž.English: <Wordwrap>Sorrowful tale of the Turk, braiding wives' hair with bliss. Yet to Jasmine, beloved, he gifted satin fair, devising vengeance against him doth the harem, a scheme beyond compare! Conspiring with an imam vile, stripped of justice in his land, stones did Jasmine kill, and buried me alive. \n<Turk>

<Wordwrap>Ako však dal dobrý Alláh, Ture.English: <Wordwrap>By Allah's grace, the Turk fled, unto the river Vah he sped! Thus, by parchment, the Hungarian king grant trade in this realm, where circumcision is not. \n<Turk>

<Wordwrap>Neuveriteľné. Hostinský, ešte.English: <Wordwrap>Unbelievable. Innkeeper, another round! Hmm, pray tell, good Turk, how doth thy culture differ? \n<Matej>

…u nas taka obyčaj, zalej sebe so mnou č.English: ...'tis a custom, quench thy thirst with me, a cup of tea for thee. \n<Turk>

A qahwah tiež pijete? Pip nám ťa odporúč.English: <Wordwrap>And dost thou also indulge in qahwah? 'Twas recommended to us by the priest. \n<Matej>

…Qahwah Turkovi karavána priváža, nebud.English: <Wordwrap>...Qahwah, brought by caravan to the Turk, shalt make thy wife not sad! \n<Turk>

Vy máte ale tempo, pijete jak o život. B.English: <Wordwrap>Ye hath quite the pace, drinking as if 'twere a matter of life or death. Borovička or Drienkovica?  \n<Innkeeper>

<Wordwrap>Drienkovicu skúsime, čo poviet.English: <Wordwrap>Let's try the Drienkovica, what say thee, good Turk? I've been pondering, what brings thee to this backwater, when there are many trading guilds in the nearby towns. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Turek qahwah rozváža, ale má r.English: <Wordwrap>The Turk delivers qahwah, enjoys company of maidens. A better brothel there not, not even in Buda. \n<Turk>

Takéto zrnká si už videl?\n\\n<Matej>.English: Hast thou seen such beans ere? \n<Matej>

Také Turek nikdy nevidel, arabicu radšej.English: Such beans the Turk not see, give the Arabic stead. \n<Turk>

Ten dze še tu vzal? Co tam sebe šuškaju?.English: What tumult ‘tis this? What clandestine whispers are exchanged? \n<Pavol>

Kto to je, pán Turek? Nejak zle sa na mň.English: Pray tell, who is this, Turk? His gaze bears ill upon me. \n<Matej>

Turek povie jeho vec, zvedavosť prehnaná.English: The Turk shall have his say, let undue curiosity be dispelled!

Ty! Máš dačo proti mne? Zle si sa na mňa.English: <Wordwrap>Thou there! Hast thou aught against me? Thou didst cast a sour look upon me, speak forthwith! \n<Matej>

Ic do rici pajačku, sa staraj o seba.\n\.English: Begone, thou drunken fool, and tend to thyself. \n<?>

Ty si isto s tými kultistami, takoj ťa r.English: <Wordwrap>Thou art allied with those cultists. I shall challenge thee! Step forth for a duel fair and square! \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Ši zošalel načisto? Ta ja nezn.English: <Wordwrap>Hath ye lost ye wits entirely? I did not expect such a reaction over a mere sip of brandy! By God, exercise some restraint! Pretend ye art in a scuffle, then suddenly fall as if ye hast fainted! \n<Pavol>

Buď ticho, Ježiš je na mojej strane, zar.English: <Wordwrap>Be still, for the grace of God is upon me; order shall soon be restored to this village! \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Ťa obdivujem, bratm, koľko mas.English: <Wordwrap>I must commend thee, brother, for thy capacity to imbibe and yet maintain thy footing! I invite thee for a pint, to toast to thy victory. 'Twill do thee good. \n<Mercenary>

Diki, hneď, len sa skočim vyšabľovac.\\n.English: Thank, I shall join thee presently, I just need to empty my bowels. \n<Pavol>

Ešči švici slunko, ale už idze čierňava..English: <WordWrap>The sun still shines, but clouds doth approach. The wind is rising. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Hej no. Cítiť vo vzduchu búrku.English: <WordWrap>Yes. You can feel it in the air. \n<Pavol>

Mam rad taky vzduch. Fuh.\n\\n<Pavol>.English: I do enjoy such weather. Pfuh. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Ne som, šak Macej asi mrtvy. T.English: <Wordwrap>Nay, I am not, for Macej is likely dead. Mayhaps he hath found peace in the heavens, I do believe so after yesterday. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>To súvisí s tým mečom?\n\\n<Ad.English: Doth it hath aught to do with that sword? \n<Adam>

<Wordwrap>Mi anjel dal. Ledva som vidzel.English: <Wordwrap>An angel bestowed it upon me. I could barely see him, as if the sun were shining at midnight. Everything was clearly visible. Before that, some devil was sneering hither. The angel told me that with fire I shall rise into heavens. He opened his mouth, but his voice sounded as if a hundred birds were chirping at once, but ever so softly. And there was peace and love, my tears fell like rain. \n<Pavol>

Kriste, tu co še porobelo? Maceju! Dze š.English: <Wordwrap>Heavens above, what tumult has befallen here? Macej! Where art ye? \n<Pavol>

Nechcel si prijať Zurvana... máš čo si c.English: That's what you get for rejecting Zurvan.

Bidáka dorichtovali, žeby ho mac nespozn.English: Poor fellow, hath been beaten to a pulp.

Dobre mu tak. Mal sa pridať, kým sme mu.English: Should have joined us while you had the chance.

Chudáka domordovali, dobodali..English: They hats slain and stabbed him mercilessly.

Keby si neriedil víno vodou, možno by sm.English: If you hadn't diluted the wine with water, we might have left you alive. \n<Paula>

Krčmár! Bože, i cebe zamordovali?\n\\n<P.English: Innkeeper! By the saints, hath ye also been dispatched? \n<Pavol>

Hrozne. Večur sa tu rehtal, teraz leži j.English: <WordWrap>Horrible fate. In the evening, laughing along me. Now lies here prone, never to stand up again. \n<Pavol>

Še zobudz!\n\\n<Pavol>.English: In the name of all that is holy, awaken! \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Panaboha, co ši mi to porobela.English: <Wordwrap>Good Lord, what hast ye done to me? Why, when we lived so well together! \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Ach, Pali, odpusť!! Veď ty si.English: <Wordwrap>Oh Pali, forgive me! Thou wert always so kind to me, until now never didst thou raise thy hand against me! 'Twas Root who induced these hallucinations, compelled me to do all this, I swear upon my soul! Thou knowest I love thee! \n<Paula>

Neverim ci ani pol slova!\n\\n<Pavol>.English: I believe not a word of it! \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Tak ma rozviaž a poď hore, tom.English: <Wordwrap>I desire naught but to be with thee forever! Weep…  And in the morning, we shall set thy friend free, thou shalt see! \n<Paula>

Jáj, laska moja… ale kedz me klameš, pri.English: Oh my love... but if thou deceivest me, by all that is sacred... \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Hmmm, by som si podriemkal ešt.English: <Wordwrap>Hmm, ye couldst use another quaff... the dead bodies must be a fever dream only... Nay, wait! First, ye must locate Matej.

No nazdar, Adam! Akurat si dobre došol!\.English: Greetings, Adam! Ye hast arrived just in time! \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Panabeka Pali, kto ťa tak doka.English: <Wordwrap>By God Pali, who hath treated thee so brutally? Wait, let me wipe thy blood, thou dost spit it everywhere.

Moja najdrahša žena utečena, pfuh, sebe.English: My dearest fled wife hath, pfuh, imagine that. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Dobrú famfatale si si našiel,.English: Thou hast found thyself quite a lively partner, with all things considered! \n<Adam>

Sam uplne neznam. Poc, rozpovim ci v hra.English: I know not entirely. Come, I shall recount all within the castle. \n<Pavol>

Ja si to tu užívam, ja sa cítim dobre. \.English: I'm enjoying it here, I'm feeling good. \n<Pisshead>

<Wordwrap>To čo má byť... vy ste si vyme.English: <Wordwrap>By my troth, what manner of deceit is this... Hast thou swapped garbs? Be it as it may, with the arcane might of Zurvan, I shall vanquish thee with ease. \n<Paula>

Toto budze perši raz, aľe za Mateja ci u.English: Tis be the first time I raise my hand on ye, and you will not forget it.\n<Pavol>

Zdržal ma bývalý. Kam šli ostatní?\n\\n<.English: I was delayed by an old acquaintance. Where hath the others gone? \n<Paula>

Do starého hradu. Keď pobehneš, možnaj i.English: To the old castle. If thou hurriest, thou mayest catch up with them. \n<Rotface>

<Wordwrap>Tadeto sa potom i naspak do le.English: Through here we can get back into the forest, if need be. \n<Ida>

Boha, ďalšia potvora. To keľo dzeci ma t.English: God, another creature. How many children hath this lad spawned? \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Pali! Toto veru nie je zrasten.English: <Wordwrap>Pali! Draw thy sword! This is no conjoined twin, but a true monstrosity! \n<Matej>

Jaaaj, moji sn' znajut vyplašiti obludu!.English: Oh, my sons, thou dost startle the monster! \n<Marian>

Jakij parobci, to divki sut! Što ty nevi.English: What sort of lads, those are maidens! Canst thou not see? \n<Marian>

Divky? Akože dzivčata to su, hej? No ja.English: <WordWrap>Maidens? Are these maidens, verily ? I doth ponder... But why dost ye continually address them as sons? One would think thee mad! \n<Pavol>

Sn' sut ditky! Dvi sn' sut dvi ditky! \\.English: They are children! Two sons are two children! \n<Marian>

<Wordwrap>Jaj, taže syn su dzeci. Dobre,.English: <Wordwrap>Ah, so ye sons ye mean children. Well, let us depart now, Matej. We thank ye kindly, farewell and may God be with you. May we return another time to sample this pear brandy. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Prosím ťa. Potrebovali by sme,.English: <WordWrap>I beseech ye. We would require thine offspring's presence in an important matter. Only to show thyemself to the Hussites at the Jew's house. Fear not, it shall be naught dreadful. We shall also compensate thee.\n<Matej>

Tu maš tricec korun. \\n<Pavol>.English: Here are thirty coins for ye. \n<Pavol>

Sn' počkajut vas kde treba. \\n<Marian>.English: They shall await thee where needed. \n<Marian>

Ty dumau, že ja neznajut počitati? To ni.English: Dost thou think they cannot count? That is not thirty coins! \n<Marian>

Bratu, počuješ ma? Čože ty tak vysoko le.English: Brother, dost thou hear me? Why dost thou climb so high? \n<Matej>

Hrušk' musim pozbirati, hrušk'! Len slab.English: <Wordwrap>I must gather pears, pears! The branches are weak, and the harvest is upon us. For it hath not rained in a moon. \n<Marian>

A nebojíš sa, že padneš? \\n<Matej>.English: And dost thou not fear falling? \n<Matej>

Što by jem sa bojau! Koli padnu, ta padn.English: <WordWrap>Why should I fear? If I fall, then so be it. I must gather the pears before nightfall! \n<Marian>

A nemáme ti pomôcť, bratu? \\n<Matej>.English: And shall we not aid thee, brother? \n<Matej>

Ni!! Nemoža! Musim pozbirati hrušk' pre.English: Ni!! It cannot be! I must gather the pears for us! \n<Marian>

<Wordwrap>To bude ten dedinský blázon, j.English: <Wordwrap>Tis the village fool, one of many. Yet even such as he should be valued, for I hath read in the writings of Brother Fouc Alta that fools possess a mysterious connection to the transcendent. But they must be treated with iron filings, for that strengthens and enlivens their spirits. And as for the maniacs, they must hath their heads plunged into icy water, for their minds are too hot and dry. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Eej! Kukaj še tu, toten blazon.English: <WordWrap>Eh! Look here, that fool knows something. He has four bottles of pear brandy in his pocket. Let me taste a bit. \n<Pavol>

Neopovažuj sa! Nielen, že chľasceš, ešte.English: Dare not! Thou not only drinketh but also desirest to steal? \n<Matej>

Daj pokuj. Stary sebe nevšimne ništ. \\n.English: Cease thy prattle. The old one shall not notice a thing. \n<Pavol>

Hk! Idzem mu pomahac, kejc taku dobru pa.English: <Wordwrap>Hc! I am going to help him, for he knows how to make fine brandy from these pears! \n<Pavol>

Keby si bol taký rezký v čine aj keď tre.English: If only thou wert as eager to do good deeds when needed! \n<Matej>

Nenehaš me? Ci narucam hruške do toteho.English: Wilt ye not let me? Or shall I send the pears into ye face? \n<Pavol>

Znaš co? Okoštujem totej jeho palinky. \.English: Very well, I shall leave it be. \n<Pavol>

Neodoláš pokušeniu ani okamih? Okradnúť.English: Ye know what I shall taste of that brandy. \n<Pavol>

Pali! Nepi to! Čo to stváraš? Kam to lez.English: Wouldst thou not refrain? Dost thou wish to rob the old man? \n<Matej>

Beľmo strachu v očiach mŕtveho..English: Fear in the eyes of the dead.

Hrozné, čo sa tu porobilo..English: Terrible what has been done here.

Jdou po nás zezadu! \\n<Husita>.English: They're coming for us from behind! \n<Hussite>

Strašná bitka sa tu odohrala..English: A terrible battle took place here.

Furt ne. Šade som šecko prekutral i na k.English: <WordWrap>Still not. I scoured the everything and knocked on every outhouse. Disappeared.\n<Ďusi>
