<Wordwrap>Hah! Nepriateľ našho nepriateľ.English: Hah! The enemy of our enemy. Ye couldst lend us some aid. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Kebyže sa chceme dostac z dzed.English: <Wordwrap>I know secret path, should we want to leave the village. Through woods I can guide, away from cultists.\n<Ida>

<Wordwrap>Kebyže sa chceme dostac z dzed.English: <Wordwrap>I know secret path, should we want to leave the village. Through woods I can guide, away from cultists. We pass trough pear gatherer hut. \n<Ida>

<Wordwrap>Nechajte ma, chlapi, idem sa o.English: <WordWrap>Leave me be, good fellows, I am off to hang myself from the linden tree. The Hussites assaulted me in my home, they entered through the cellar window. Those cursed, drunken scoundrels poured into the house and got the idea to baptize me. \n<Jew>

<Wordwrap>A to zľe? Šak sice spravidla s.English: <WordWrap>And is that so dire? While it is customary to be baptized only once in life, it may not be harmful even if they baptize ye twice, just for certainty. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Ale ja som žid! Pokrstili ma a.English: <WordWrap>But I am a Jew! They baptized me and tried to force huspenina, that pork gelatinous concoction into my throat. They laughed and cavorted like swine in the sty. Oh, I tremble with anger as I recount this. \n<Jew>

<Wordwrap>Žid hovoríš? Richtár nas posla.English: <WordWrap>A Jew, you say? The burgmaster sent us after ye. Worse affairs plague the land, so let us not stir further discord here. Cultists sow mischief. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Horše veci sa tu deju v kraji,.English:
<WordWrap>Worse affairs plague the land, so let us not stir further discord here. Cultists sow mischief. . 
\n<Pavol>

Nuž ale priviedli sme zbrojnošoch, aby p.English:
<WordWrap>Well, we hath enlisted soldiers to aid against the Hussites.
They do not fight for free. \n<Pavol>

Šak si chcel husitoch z domu vypakovac,.English: <Wordwrap>Ye didst seek to oust the Hussites from the house, and now they are not within.\n<Pavol>

Dom ale mal zostať stáť!\\n<Žid>.English: But the house was meant to remain standing! \n<Jew>

Veď ne my sme ho rozburdali. Husiti pase.English: <Wordwrap>'Twas not us who razed it. 'Twas the Hussites who wrought havoc. Ye set something ablaze therein.\n<Pavol>

Husita mal pri sebe \\c[14]lekvár\\c[0].English: Hussite had \c[14]jam\c[0] and \c[14]sour cream\c[0] with him.

Ci pana. Maceji, šak ich tam jak hadoch..English: Dear God, behold a venerable serpent's nest.\n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Mohli by sme ich ľsťou vydúriť.English: <Wordwrap>We could outsmart them with cunning. Summoning the pear gatherer and his kin, the Hussites would think a cult is attacking them and flee. Then we shall capture them. Or perhaps another could join our cause. \n<Matej>

Mali by sme získať posily. Snáď nám niek.English: <Wordwrap>We should acquire reinforcements. Perhaps someone from the castle or the village shall aid us. \n<Matej>

Tak ako? Ideme predsa na nich?\\n<Matej>.English: How now? Shall we advance upon them. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Mohli by sme ich ľsťou vydúriť.English: <Wordwrap>We could outsmart them with cunning. Summoning the pear gatherer and his kin, the Hussites would think a cult is attacking them and flee. Then we shall capture them. Or perhaps another could join our cause. \n<Matej>

Mali by sme získať posily. Snáď nám niek.English: <Wordwrap>We should acquire reinforcements. Perhaps someone from the castle or the village shall aid us. \n<Matej>

Sn'! Zlate moje, pocce še ukazac tuhľa p.English: Rise, my children, show thyself to these gentlemen. \n<Pavol>

Doprdele, co to je ty, vole! \\n<Husita>.English: Bloody hell, what in the world is this! \n<Hussite>

Vidzel som i koňa v lufte srac... ale to.English: I’ve seen a horse defecate mid flight… yet this… \n<Pavol>

Sn', môžete odísť.\\n<Matej>.English: Thanks be to thee, you may depart. \n<Matej>

Naša robota tuna je dokončena. Ideme dom.English: <Wordwrap>Our task is complete in this place. Let us make way back home.\n<Man at arms>

Isto sa tam husiti schádzajú.\nMať tak n.English:
<WordWrap>Verily, 'tis where those Hussites must gather.
If only we possessed some manner of explosive. 'Twould swiftly dislodge them. \n<Matej>

Počkaj ešte, trošku to premyslíme. \\n<M.English: Let us tarry a moment, and ponder this course. \n<Matej>

Ty co tu furt sa obšmietaš? Sme ci ne ja.English: <WordWrap>Why are ye still around? Did we not clearly tell ye that ye are to leave at once? \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Pomstiť idzem mojich druhoch..English: <Wordwrap>To avenge my comrades. The cultist poisoned Bruno and kiled the others. I will not fall asleep until I plunder them. \n<Ida>

<Wordwrap>Hm, znaš co? Pokračuj, nebudze.English: <Wordwrap>Hm, ye know what? Go on, we will leave ye undisturbed. But God forbid, shall I see ye trying to nick something! \n<Pavol>

Už neška troch som dobila kultistoch. Sn.English: <WordWrap>I've already conquered three cultists. They are trying to rob the Jew. \n<Zlodejka Ida>

Chlapi! Ďakujem, že ste prišli! Zas sa m.English: <WordWrap>Merry men! Thank you for coming! Again, some criminals tried to break in, this time I closed the cellar window. Here's a \c[14]fig\c[0] as reward. \n<Jew>

<Wordwrap>Nešťastník v pästi zviera delo.English: <Wordwrap>The unfortunate lad gris a petard in his fist. He probably wanted to detonate it, but his hands couldn't come close together.

Možno to bol dajaky lesný robotník, abo.English: Maybe it was some forest worker, or someone like that.

Čo vy tu ešte? Hádam ste vydumali pohon.English: What else are you here for? Have you figured out the drive for the balloon?\n<Jew>

<Wordwrap>Tak by som sa chcel venovať vý.English: <Wordwrap>Oh how much I want to do research. But lately, seemingly everyone has been trying to conquer my abode.\n<Jew>

Tak by som sa chcel venovať výskumu. Ale.English: <Wordwrap>Oh how much I want to do research. But lately, seemingly everyone has been trying to conquer my abode.\n<Jew>

Rozbité sudy. Husiti všetko pobrali. Okr.English: Plundered barells. The Hussites took all, except for this \c[14]fig\c[0].

Prosím vás, nehrabte sa mi vo veciach.\\.English: I beg of you, do not rummage through my things.\n<Jew>

Poničené nádoby. V jednej ostalo ale \\c.English: Broken caskets. Only one \c[14]plum wine\c[0] remained here.

Nejaký husita sem odložil \\c[14]striebo.English: <WordWrap>Some Hussite left a \c[14]silver medailon\c[0] with the portrait of Hus here. May come handy.

<Wordwrap>Cežky balon budze. Tu še rychl.English: <Wordwrap>We must pack the balloon lightly. Quickly, conceal yeself in the cellar. Or seek refuge high in a tree in the forest. Day without sustenance ye shalt endure. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>To možno. Rýchlosť, ktorou ale.English: <WordWrap>Mayhap. The swiftness with which I must labor, however, doth compel me to create works that do capture reality in its raw essence.\n<Painter>

...ci. Dobre si to zachytil. By si mi to.English: ..aye. Thou hast captured it well. Wouldst thou not give it to me?\n<Pavol>

Asi som si grcol do pusy. \\n<Ogrgeľ>.English: I think I puked a little in me mouth.\n<Drunkard>

Ach.\n<br>Nuž dobre, ale zajtra musíme í.English:

Je možne toto? Kukaj, asi še ci splnilo.English: Could it be. Seems yer wish came true. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Čo?? Akým mužom Matejom? Ja pr.English: <Wordwrap>What?? What former husband Matej? I, of course... Marek, thou knowest that thou art the only one for me. \n<Paula>

<Wordwrap>Sa nehraj na glupu, som ce s n.English: <Wordwrap>Do not play the fool with me, I saw thee with him, as we abducted Pali. Thou still lovest him, stop lying to me that thou hast killed him! \n<Marek>

<Wordwrap>Ale toto nie je on, vzali ste.English: <Wordwrap>But this is not him, ye hath taken that monk Matej... thee must hath deliberately exchanged clothes. \n<Paula>

<Wordwrap>Ti už ani slovo neverim, jak š.English: <Wordwrap>I trust not a word from thee anymore, how hast thou concealed it from me! I shall be the one to attain immortality through the merging with Angra Mainyu! Now I command here, thou treacherous one. Men! Seize her! \n<Marek>

<Wordwrap>Hah, ty jeden malý červ! Ide t.English: <Wordwrap>Hah, thee little worm! Fajne, celý svet je môj teraz.\n\\n<Paul.English:

\n<Paula>

<Wordwrap>Tadeto smom... som cho-chodil.English: <WordWrap>Through hrer... here I went. To the rock hill. Ugly, piss stained, repugnant, ugly rock hill. As if it was cursed, the whole place! A ghostly figure would traverse the... the place. Wonder noone thrashed him like a horse!\n<Drunkard>

<Wordwrap>Lesom tu ide cesta... Do lesa.English: <WordWrap>A path goes through the forest here... Into the forest, the path goes. At the end of the path... forest is no more. <Wordwrap>Mno, chlapci moji. Do dediny b.English:

<Wordwrap>Husitov tu po lese je jak mrav.English: <Wordwrap>The Hussites infest the forest akin to ants. Were we to rescue all they assail, a legion of a thousand men would be insufficient. \n<Burgmaster>

<Wordwrap>Daj mi pokuj s heslama gluptak.English: <Wordwrap>Give me peace with ye passwords, fool! What hast ye forgotten, that ye art here again? I conversed with ye leader, I know not what ye took, that the information hath not remained within thy skull. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Najperšej poženieme husitoch s.English: <Wordwrap>We aim first to expel the Hussites from our lands! For years they've sown chaos here. Pomstime dnes Jančiho, Feriho, i šicke k.English: <Wordwrap>This day shall see vengeance for Janči, Feri, and all those wronged by the cultists. \n<Knight>

Ci panečku, už dlho nebula taka akcia. K.English: <Wordwrap>By God, it hath been long since such excitement graced our path! My nerves doth tremble with anticipation. \n<Knight>

Budeme tu čakať na vaše znamenie. Potom.English: <WordWrap>We'll await your signal, and rush the fortress with utmost haste. \n<Knight>

<Wordwrap>Dobrý večer, pane, volám sa Ig.English: <Wordwrap>Greetings, noble sir, I am Ignác. 'Tis said thou hast proved thy fealty to our cause. Yet, I ponder, whence hast thou come, and what hath piqued thy curiosity about our fellowship? \n<Ignác>

<Wordwrap>Žena mi ušla. Zapredam dušu i.English: <Wordwrap>Milady hath absconded from my side. I bargain my soul to Satan himself for her return. Thus, I hath a proposition. \n<Ignác>

<Wordwrap>Potrebujeme dostať utečenca, z.English: <Wordwrap>We seek to apprehend a fugitive, a turncoat from our ranks, by the name of Bohdan. He bears teeth inked upon his posterior. Upon his capture, dispose of his remains and present me with a fragment of his hindquarters. I personally etched the mark, hence I shall detect any deception. We've already wrung confessions from his kin; they know naught of his whereabouts. \n<Ignác>

<Wordwrap>Naposledy sme ho videli vojsť.English: <Wordwrap>We last glimpsed him entering yon church, yet within its walls, he eluded us. Yet, I must return to the matters of parchment; the logistics surrounding qahwah are more intricate than one might fathom. Once thy mission is accomplished, a share of the distribution may be entrusted to thee; coin shall flow. \n<Ignác>

Vitajte páni, máte, čo som požadoval? \n.English: Greetings, gentlemen, hast thou brought what I requested? \n<Ignác>

Tu mace, ale už to začina šmerdzec.\n\\n.English: Here ye hast, yet it doth begin to reek. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Výborne. Tak bratu Mateji, čož.English: <Wordwrap>Excellent. Now, to thee, Brother Matej, what brings thee unto us, unworthy occultists? What hath turned thee away from the righteous path? \n<Ignác>

<Wordwrap>Nuž, do kláštora, kde som ilum.English: <Wordwrap>Well, within the monastery where I illuminated, my younger sister once came to visit me, a mere innocent... the abbot violated her when she went to confess to him. When I discovered this, I began to trumpet it forth, but the brethren sided with the abbot, claiming I sought to discredit him and branding me a heretic possessed by Satan. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Do rána ma aj so sestrou chcel.English: <Wordwrap>By morning, they intended to deliver me and my sister unto the Inquisition, but Brother Gyusi aided me in escaping. Since then, paradoxically, I hath indeed mingled among heretics and discovered much good therein. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Skutočne ale túžim po pozícii.English: <Wordwrap>Truly, however, I yearn for a position within a powerful sect capable of fulfilling my vengeance and murdering Gejza of Debrecín, ideally even wiping out the entire monastery. I do not know much about your organization; I only know Catholic heretics... Savonarola, Hus, and Abbot Estefan.\n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Aká milá náhoda, s Estefanim a.English:
What a delightful coincidence! We directly cooperate with Estefan and his Catholics on organizing caravans of qahwah from Ethiopia, as our source is not favored in the Muslim world. \!
Did Bohdan advise thee to mention him? Didst thou bind his wounds well enough to prevent him from bleeding out? 'Tis a very nice story thou hast prepared. \n

<Wordwrap>Šťastnou náhodou sa tu pred ch.English: <Wordwrap>By a stroke of luck, Pali's gentle half stopped by a moment ago for a chat. I know everything. I inquired about thee as well, and she discovered that a more obedient lamb than thee would scarcely be found in Debrecín. What sayest thou to that? \n<Ignác>

<Wordwrap>Mamka barz sa durdila na mňa,.English: <Wordwrap>My dear mother frowned upon me when I left home, but when we expel the Hussites, surely even she shall embrace Zurvan. \n<Cultist>

Všade sú tu zrnká Qahwah. Väčšina je sur.English: Qahwah grains are scattered everywhere. Most of them in raw state.

Sa udusil dymom. Poďme ho obracic. \\n<P.English: Choked on smoke. Let us turn him over.\n<Pavol>

Dajaky vyzera byť... Odtál ne, odtál ne..English: He seems to be .. No, not from here, not from here.\n<Drunkard>

No ale daco divne še tu robi. Tu na horn.English: <WordWrap>Well something strange is afoot here. Turks hath no place here in the north, spy perhaps.\n<Pavol>

Pekne to tu upratali. \\n<Matej>.English: They made sure to clean this place up nicely. \n<Matej>

Šarlatán v posmrtnom kŕči schúlený. Celk.English: A charlatan curled up in postmortem spasm. He was quite young.

Vypratať to tu musíme! Čo keď sem dakto.English: <WordWrap>We must clear this place! What if some interloper should come snoop around?\n<Charlatan>

Diľina, mysleli, že nas premožu. \\n<Pav.English: Dullards, ye thought to best us.\n<Pavol>

Nemusel si ich tak domárovať, s prerezan.English: <WordWrap>Thou need'st not have been so brutal; with slit throats, they shall reveal naught unto us.\n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>To je ale krásny pach… pripomí.English: <WordWrap>Verily, what a sweet scent doth fill the air... it doth bring to mind I dreamed ecstasy of Saint Teresa. Few things in this mortal coil are as fair as when pleasant dreams doth grace thy slumber. Remember, it doth speak to the purity of the soul and the righteousness of the path.\n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Ta ja sa stavim, že ďablovi še.English: <WordWrap>By my troth, I wager the devil hath dreams of beautiful saints every night. Forsooth, this scent doth remind me of a plump maid from the hamlet of Vranov...\n<Pavol>

Kukaj ale sem na zem, to zaš je co? \\n<.English: <WordWrap>But look here, what be yon on ground?\n<Pavol>

Hej, Pavol! Nejedz to zrno, čo keď je je.English: <WordWrap>Hark, Pavol! Partake not of that seed, for what if it be poisonous? \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Nič še nebuj, ich len berem uk.English: <WordWrap>Nay, fret not, I do but show it unto the lord, for he hath fondness for oriental flora. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>No a čomu slúži táto divná kov.English: <WordWrap>And what purpose doth this curious metallic contraption serve? I have beheld something akin, whereon diabolical melodies were played, spinning and clanging. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Za to im dozaista Lucifer do d.English: <WordWrap>Methinks Lucifer himself didst bestow upon them the fruit of the infernal Zaqqum tree, whence this scent and bones doth come. It flourisheth in the fire at the depths of hell. The fruit doth bear a subtle portrait of Satan, as on a Roman coin, and he doth compel the damned to partake, whereupon it burneth in their bellies like acid. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Chujoviny dristaš. Ale daso ba.English: <WordWrap>Ye speakest folly. But something wicked doth brew here. We must forthwith inform our lord.\n<Pavol>

Poďme už preč, cítim tu zlé duchy. Stmie.English: <WordWrap>Let us away, for I sense malevolent spirits here. The shadows lengthen.\n<Matej>

Zaprete su dvere zos dnuka..English: Something holds these doors from inside.

Še vzdaj i odidz het, skadzi ši prišol..English: <Wordwrap>Surrender and leave this place at once, return from whence ye hast come. Grant us holy peace. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Vrátiť sa odkiaľ pochádzam nie.English: <Wordwrap>I cannot return to the place of my origins. Pavol, release me from this plight, and I shall spare thy life. I discern in thee a fervent disdain for the Turks, burning deep within thy soul. Show me the path, and I shall embark upon a quest to lay waste to their lands, reducing them to naught but ash. I am not malevolent, as thou well knowest. Devastation is but a necessary step towards the dawn of a new creation. \n<Ahriman>

<Wordwrap>Tak ako dospievaním vraždíte k.English: <Wordwrap>As adolescence doth consume a part of the child within, shrouded in unspeakable agony, so must backward nations be sacrificed upon the altar of progress. And progress, as thou dost well know, is embodied in the Austro-Hungarian monarchy. I sow the flames, preparing the soil for the emergence of the new, much like a plow doth uproot the weeds. \n<Ahriman>

Joj, dosc si už rozosieval, daj pokuj..English: Cease thy sowing and bestow peace upon us. \n<Pavol>

Vybral si si. Zhyň!\\n<Ahriman>.English: Thou hast made thy choice. Perish! \n<Ahriman>

Dve ohnive meče? Može byc.\\n<Pavol>.English: Two fiery blades? So be it! \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Pozor! Zaiste je prekliaty, ne.English: <Wordwrap>Take care! This one surely is cursed! You must not fight with it, lest a terrbile curse will fall onto us.\n<Matej>

Dobre, ta ale aspoň do teho nolabu ho mo.English: It can power noollab at the very least.\n<Pavol>

Inskripcie znázorňujú asi obetný rituál..English: The inscriptions depict some form of sacrificial rite. \n<Matej>

Dyť já tú sošku znám, to jest pod kostol.English: I recognize that statue; it rests beneath the church. \n<Kandich>

Totu sochu už sme vidzeli, ne? Pod kosce.English: <Wordwrap>We hath beheld that statue ere now, hath we not? 'Tis housed within the catacombs beneath the church. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>A toten chlop vypatra jak naš.English: <Wordwrap>And this lad resembles our Janči. Adam, I hath forgotten that we keep in the larder one of those mutated qahwah beasts. Let us proceed with the autopsy. \n<Pavol>

Zázrak! Vravel som ti Pali, že Boh je na.English: This a miracle! I told thee, Pali, that God is on our side! \n<Matej>

Hej, šak ja znam. Aľe dze je Adam? Adam.English: Aye, I know. But where is Adam? Adam! \n<Pavol>

Tu som... ešte v nólabe... dajte mi min.English: <Wordwrap>Here I am... still in the basket... give me a minute... I'll be on my feet in a moment. \n<Adam>

To si mohol povedať, že máš strach z výš.English: Thou couldst hath mentioned thou art afraid of heights! \n<Matej>

Až sa nám podarí zneškodniť kultistov, b.English: Once we rid this place of cultistic presence, we may use the nalloob to leave.

Zapadané kamením. Až tak magicky to tu u.English: Not magic held this door, but rocks. Maybe both.

Mŕtvy okultista, jakeby ho niečo roztrhl.English: A fallen cultist, rent in twain.

Kristove rany, tu riadny masaker musel p.English: By Christ, what massacre took place here?\n<Pavol>

Strašný je démon, čo takúto spúšť spôsob.English: Terrible is the demon, who caused this carnage.\n<Matej>

Niečo hrozné sa tu muselo odohrať, tento.English: A terrible death befell this cultist. ‘Tis impossible to say what happened to him.

Mŕtvy kultista, rozseknutý je na pol..English: The cultist is clawed, as if a pack of wolves attacked him.

Snažil sa zahojiť, než dodýchal. \\c[14].English:
Tried to save himself, yet he didn't manage to drink the \c[14]wine\c[0] in time.
We shall take it.

Hrozná smrť postihla tohoto okultistu. A.English: Terrible fate awaited this poor cultist. What happened to him cannot be described.

Kultista je dodriapaný, sťa by svorka vl.English: Something foul must hath unfolded herein; this cultist lacks a head.

Všade sú tu zrnká qahwah rozhádzané..English: A slain cultist, as if something rend him asunder.

<Wordwrap>Ucahany som jak koň. Poc, idze.English: <Wordwrap>I am wearied as a steed. Come, let us retire to the tavern for the night's rest. The castle holds no allure for me at this hour. A breakfast of eggs and ale shall fortify me in the morn. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Tak ci povim, Maceji, bars som.English: <Wordwrap>Indeed, Master Matej, I find solace in our merry discourse. It distracts me from idle thoughts. It heartens me to see the world teeming with activity. Alas, I cannot seem to arrest the march of time; it gallops on like a wild stallion, troubling my soul deeply. Yet, were it to halt, I know not if I could bear it. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>To rád čujem, brat môj. Príliš.English: <Wordwrap>Your words hearten me, brother. Though I cannot wholly grasp their truth, if it be God's will, mayhap I shall guide thee onto the path of righteousness. Verily, I too have found some respite emerging from my meditative seclusion within the cell into the light of day. God's ways are truly inscrutable. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Ale povedz mi, prečo si začal.English: <Wordwrap>But tell me, why dost thou drown thy sorrows in drink? Thou art not foolish, surely. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Ta znaš jak... i keď... ech.\\.English: Well, ye see... even though... ech. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Po bitke v Kosove, Turci jak n.English: <Wordwrap>After the battle of Kosovo, when the Turks laid us low and took me captive, I faced a sword at my throat, poised to cleave my head for the Sultan's delight. Yet, a thunderous blast from a cannon echoed through the air. In the ensuing chaos, I managed to dispatch my captor. Disguising myself in his garb beyond the place of execution, I slipped away. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Odvtedy ale mam na karku chlad.English: <Wordwrap>Since then, however, a cold spot upon my neck lingers, as if that sword still hangs over me. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Pome pod duchny spac už.\\n<Pa.English: Let us seek our rest now. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Zdravim vospolok, jedno pivko.English:
Greetings, good fellow! Pour me a pint of ale. And as for that fool over yonder, pay him no mind, he's as stubborn as a mule.\n
Or perhaps a mug of the church's wine, that might sooth his soul. \n
<WordWrap>Greetings, good fellow! Pour me a pint of ale. Finally I can enjoy a pint in peace. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Takoj, chlope. Skadzi ši sem d.English: Good man from where hast thou come?\n<Innkeeper>

<Wordwrap>Ja som od Šariša, ľem mi žena.English: <WordWrap>I am from Šariš, and my wife hath fled from me. Have ye seen a beauty with blue eyes? \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Takych kižasoňkoch tu je dosc,.English: <WordWrap>Hath an abundance of such here, for a brothel doth reside in our village, I bid thee imagine! The priest and the burgmaster have convened on this matter, yet the people somehow have not driven them away as they ought.\n<Innkeeper>

<Wordwrap>Jáj, paradne pivo mace, chladn.English: <WordWrap>Oh, goodly ale, friend, chilled! 'Tis akin to our homely brews. Matej, dost ye not wish to sample? Wherefore dost ye stand yonder, lost in scowly face. \n<Pavol>
<WordWrap>Oh, goodly ale, friend, chilled! 'Tis akin to our homely brews. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Ši še predviedol Vlado. Si nas.English:
<Wordwrap>Ye hast shown thyself, Vlado. Ye didst leave us at the mercy of the foe; we would have prevailed if ye didn't flee like a coward!
\n<Ščevo>

<Wordwrap>...ser naňho Števo, to nema zm.English:
<Wordwrap>...pay him no mind, Števo, 'tis futile, he's a fool. Cousin, indeed, we agreed to stand together, that we would be your hired mercenaries, but not that thou wouldst abandon us to our fate. What was that?
\n<Maťo>

<Wordwrap>Ta... mi prepačte, keď ja som.English: <Wordwrap>Forgive me... for I schemed thus, thinking they would not dare to fight us when we outnumber them, but... if we had beaten that monk, contract or no contract, he would have settled it with the lord, who now merely scoffs at him. I panicked a bit.\n<Priest Vlado>

<Wordwrap>Och, bože, ta teraz ši to vyšp.English: <Wordwrap>Oh, God, thou hast schemed it perfectly now... Anyway, at least go for more branches for the fire, lest we get cold until morning.\n<Maťo>

<Wordwrap>Tak, tak, ic ty hľadac drevo V.English: <Wordwrap>So, so, let thy gather wood, Vlado, whilst we make ourselves comfortable here on the moss. Ye art our squire, hehehe.\n<Ščevo>

<Wordwrap>Hej, hej, dobre hutoriš Števo,.English: <Wordwrap>Ye, aye, well said, Števo. And we shall enjoy a sip of that nutmeg liquor I unearthed in the garden for my birthday... Vlado, art thou still here? Make haste to the forest and fetch branches, lest I see thee loitering. Now, begone! \n<Maťo>

<Wordwrap>Hej, hej, už idem.\\n<Vlado>.English: Aye, aye, I am going.\n<Priest Vlado>

<Wordwrap>Čuj Matuš, taaa... ja som dost.English:
<Wordwrap>Hear me, Matuš, ahhh... I've got such a brilliant idea... we should come up with something, since we're now on the run in the woods. See, nuts are falling everywhere here. We could set up a nut distillery. Hehe. We could burn a barrel here and then they'll slowly forget about our thrashing.
\n<Ščevo>

<Wordwrap>Pošleme pipa riskovac život do.English: <Wordwrap>Let's send the priest to risk his life and limb into the village and call some maidens. At least some use he will be to us.\n<Ščevo>

<Wordwrap>Nooooo, to je dačo! To sa mi p.English: <WordWrap>Hmm, I'd want some music too. But I know not if musicians doth be good in the village... Ah well, we shall find out, the priest will handle everything. \n<Maťo>

<Wordwrap>No! Teraz na nich zaútočme!\\n.English: Now let us have at them. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Maceju, nedaš sebe pokoja? Šak.English: <Wordwrap>Matej, canst ye not cease? Behold, the dullards finally want to do something of value. We shall approach and partake in their revelry once they throw their party.\n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Joj, ty by si furt iba koštova.English: Oh, thou wouldst only indulge thyself incessantly. We must attack, I tell thee! \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Zase ja, pozri na chudáka zeme.English: <Wordwrap>Once again, 'twas I. Look upon the pitiful lord, how he weeps. He mentioned he shall summon a chess tutor from Buda, to teach him some tricks. Alas, my abbot Gejza from Debrecen is a grandmaster, one would scarcely find a better... \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Raz ťa porazím, len keď si nev.English: I shall defeat you someday, only should I remember how a knight moves! \n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Nuž, šachy sú ťažké remeslo, t.English: Well, chess is a craft that requires much study. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Toto ja neviem. Bohužiaľ, tiet.English: <Wordwrap>I cannot say. Alas, such matters are held in strict secrecy. Seek information from the bureaucratic acolyte Ignác; he oversees the dealings concerning qahwah. \n<Bohdan>

<Wordwrap>Spolupracovník Koreňa. Spolu p.English: <Wordwrap>The Turk stood as the right hand of Root, their ventures entwined as they cometh  into our realm. \n<Bohdan>

<Wordwrap>Jeden lúpežný rytier, rodák z.English: <Wordwrap>A rogue knight from Prešov ventured afar to distant lands, imbibing the teachings of a peculiar branch of Zurvanism in Armenia. He sought to propagate this faith upon his return, yet it was the backing of Root that granted him success in recruiting new adherents. \n<Bohdan>

<Wordwrap>Bystré dievča. Rýchlo sa priuč.English: <Wordwrap>Pauli, a swift-witted maiden, swiftly acquainted herself with our arcane rituals, proving herself a masterful conjurer in her own right. She joined our ranks but a scant few moons ago. \n<Bohdan>

<Wordwrap>Tak, od Bohdana sme sa doznali.English: <Wordwrap>From Bohdan's lips, we hath gathered all the needed knowledge. What be our next course of action? \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Pôjdem s vami! Vezmeme aj Ďusi.English: <Wordwrap>I shall join thy company! We shall also bring Ďusi, he is a capable man-at-arms. Meanwhile, we shall confine here present mister cultist to the dungeon. \n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Pred ten brloh kultistický roz.English: <Wordwrap>Before the entrance to their den, let us position my soldiers. They shall await our signal, then we shall cause a distraction, and signal from the window. \n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Počkať, to ste kožu zo mňa nad.English:
<Wordwrap>Wait! So you peeled my skin for nothing?
\n<Bohdan>

Daj pokuj. \\n<Pavol>.English: Hush now. Into the dungeon with ye.\n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Skrze Ignáca sa isto dostaneme.English: <Wordwrap>Through Ignác, to Root we shall find our path. We shall hinder him from ever importing Qahwah hither again. \n<Jozef>

<Wordwrap>Ta ale on nam to len tak nevyk.English: <Wordwrap>But he shall not easily reveal his secrets. He is suspicious enough. I hath to resort to deceit, claiming Matej a heretic and they seek to burn him in Debrecen, saying he would verify it... \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Keď chce tvrdiť, že je heretik.English: <Wordwrap>If thee insists on branding Matej a heretic, a pentagram on his chest I could make. \n<Bohdan>

<Wordwrap>To nie! \\!\n<br><Wordwrap>Bez.English:
Nay! Absolutely not! \!
Nevertheless, Ignác swiftly would discern the fresh tattoo. He would reveal us straightaway. \n

<Wordwrap>Pravda. Čítal si aspoň nejaké.English: <Wordwrap>Truth. Hast thou perused any tomes from the Index Librorum Prohibitorum? \n<Bohdan>

<Wordwrap>Máločo, ale poznám spisy brata.English: <Wordwrap>Scant few, but the works of Brother Savonarola, Hus, and Estifanoso I am acquainted with. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Čo si hneď nevravel, drž sa is.English: <Wordwrap>Why didst thou not speak of this sooner? Stick to the writings of those Ethiopian Stephanites, for I hath heard our cause hath some affiliation with them. Yet, I doubt if Ignác shall reveal aught unto thee, for he is wary. Nevertheless, I hath noticed that he records all within his calendar. Seek to acquire it. \n<Bohdan>

<Wordwrap>Treba mac daco v zalohe. Vonku.English: <Wordwrap>We must have a contingency plan. Our comrade with the bow shall await. And when we give the signal, he shall loose a flaming arrow into the window, and amidst the confusion, we shall seize it. Yet, make certain it doth not strike Ignác, for then we shall face dire consequences. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Znamenie treba čo najjednoduch.English: <Wordwrap>The signal must be simple. Let us say, when I cast my gaze out the window. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Uf, mi riadne duni vof gebuli..English: Oy, my head doth pound mightily. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Čo to bolo?! Au... sám čert je.English: What devilry was that?! Alas... mayhaps the devil aid her. Hogy bosorkányos!\n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Nas dobili riadne. Ta aspoň ga.English: <Wordwrap>We hath been thoroughly thrashed. At least our britches remain.\n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Idzeme ich hľedac. Ale za zeme.English: <Wordwrap>We pursue them. But in such a state, we cannot venture forth to the lord, for he shall banish us. We should try and approach the burgmaster. I yet possess keepsake of hers, that hood. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Nejaký pes by tú cigánku mohol.English: Mayhap a hound could scent out that gypsy harlot. \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Džamore, gádži... fajny ši buj.English: Džamore, gádž... a sight... ya fair well in hey? Oy,  ye rugged manbear. \n<Thief>

<Wordwrap>Hej, ale zos lupičku som ešči.English: <Wordwrap>Aye, but I hath not pilfered a rogue like ye yet. Heh, not counting my old woman! Ye be pinching sheets between ye thighs for a year or two in the oubliette! \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Co še nahaňaš, že mnich pri ce.English: <Wordwrap>What ye jabbering , cause a monk by you side? He should go church and pray for an hour. All the trinkets I pilfered, I return them all. \n<Thief>

<Wordwrap>Ty co si pijana? To ci jedno,.English: <Wordwrap>Art ye drunk? Does it matter if we bind ye in chains? Or upon the rack? Be silent, lest I put a bolt betwixt ye eyes. Let us away. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Modlitba obnovila tvoje sily!\.English:
The prayer restored your strength!
All your wounds have healed.

<Wordwrap>Rýchlo, poďme dovnútra! Snáď s.English: Haste, let us enter swiftly! Mayhap nothing dire hath occurred! \n<Jew>

<Wordwrap>Och, chvála na nebi! Husiti to.English: Oh, praise be to the heavens! The Hussites hath not laid it to ruin. \n<Jew>

<Wordwrap>Moja najväčšia cennosť, našťas.English: <Wordwrap>My most prized possession, thankfully, remaineth unharmed. The contraption capable of flight, I procured it in Florence. Yet, the final aspect remains elusive, the source of heat. Wood and coal are too heavy, it cannot take flight... for years hath I pondered upon this. I call it... Noollab. \n<Jew>

<Wordwrap>To je pekne, ale my potrebujem.English: <Wordwrap>Indeed, but we do require knowledge of the cultists, where might we find them? \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Ľutujem, neviem... ale vyhráža.English: <Wordwrap>Alas, I know not, for they threatened me with death should I divulge their secret hideout - they gather at the lord's fortified mansion, Villa Elektra, west of the village. Yet, I know not how thou might infiltrate among them... try to observe a sign by which they recognize each other. \n<Jew>

<Wordwrap>Fialové plášte nosia len pri o.English: <Wordwrap>They wear purple cloaks only during open assaults... but whence shall I procure funds for the windows? At least a hundred coins would be a boon. \n<Jew>

<Wordwrap>Maľoval som pre nich také ozdo.English: <Wordwrap>I once painted ornate fangs for them, it was quite a profitable deal. If thou dost spy such vampiric fangs upon their helmets, thou art in their midst! \n<Jew>

<Wordwrap>Upírske zuby, hej? Dobri, budz.English:
Vampiric fangs, eh? Very well, we shall be wary of them. \!
And tell me, whence doth the funding for those purple cloaks arise? It must require substantial wealth. \n

<Wordwrap>Tak to už neviem. Musí ich nie.English: Alas, I know not. Some affluent benefactor must be financing them. \n<Jew>

<Wordwrap>Hnusny ste jak riť!\\n<Pavol>.English: As ugly as an ass ye are!\n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Naša robota tuna je dokončena..English: Our task is complete in this place. Let us make way back home.\n<Man at arms>

<Wordwrap>Tu mace na pivko. Diky chlapci.English: Here, some coin for ale, for you endeavours. Thank you.\n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Hmmm, nedam vas teda zahlušic.English: <Wordwrap>Hmmm, I shan't have thou killed on the spot then. However, if thou dost wish to join us, ye must fulfill a task for us. If successful, we shall armor arm thee. Together, we shall drive the Hussites first from our lands, then from Spiš. \n<Cultist supervisor>

<Wordwrap>To znie blahosklonne. Nuž, ako.English: That sounds gracious. Well, how may we assist thee? \n<Matej>

<Wordwrap>Sme čuli take od špehov, že ze.English: <Wordwrap>We hath heard from spies that the lord keeps a secret painting in his chamber, highly prized. Bring it to us. Heh... comrades, I hath heard'tis a nude woman! Such a sight I hath never seen. \n<Cultist supervisor>

<Wordwrap>Pohoda, do večura ju maš tu. \.English: Agreed, you shall have it by nightfall. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Vytrim, vytrim, ne tak zhurta..English: <Wordwrap>Patience, patience, not so hastily. Here are the keys. They are for a cabin outside the castle. Once inside, traverse the grounds, ford the river, and you shall find the secret passage! \n<Cultist supervisor>

<Wordwrap>Získal si \\c[14]kľúčik od chy.English: You received \c[14]the key to the cabin\c[0] by the castle.

<Wordwrap>Cipana, tajna chodba hej? Dobr.English: A hidden passage, indeed? Well noted. \n<Pavol>

<Wordwrap>Najperšej poženeme husitoch st.English: <Wordwrap>We aim first to expel the Hussites from our lands! For years they've sown chaos here. And when our numbers swell, we shall drive out Jiskra of Spiš and all his followers. And in the end, we shall rid ourselves of the lord! \n<Cultist supervisor>

O židovi....English: Let us discourse regarding the Jew

Akorat to heslo mi pripomeň..English: Just remind me of the password.

Hmmm... ta to še mi pozdava calkom..English: Hmm... your proposal appeals to me well.

Uhni len, idem len pozreť, či vinko dobr.English: Step aside. I only wish to see if wine is stored here.

Raz darmo, okuštujem a basta..English: Once only, I shall taste and that's it.

Nejeduj sa. Si len srandu z cebe robim..English: Do not fret. I jest with thee.

Pridzem inokedy..English: I will return some other time.

Zemepan nas po byliny poslal..English: The lord sent us for some herbs.

O židovi rozpravajme..English: Let me tell you about the Jew.

Nebuj še nič, paru ožratych čehúňov dám.English: I can best a couple of drunken boors, even if somewhat inebriated myself.

Privolim ti, treba to vydumac. Totych hu.English: Aye, it must be thought out. We cannot best these Hussites in a pair.

Radšej nie, predsa. Daco vydumajme..English: Better not, perhaps. Let us think of something.

Dačo inše podnikneme radšej..English: Mayhap 'tis bettre to pursue another course of action.

Ešte mi povidz, kto to financuje cale..English: Tell me, who is funding all of this.

Co chce toten vaš kult dosiahnuť vlastne.English: What is the aim of ye cult, in truth?

Ideme po totu maľufku..English: Let us be off now, to retrieve that painting.

Nemame nič pre teba, dedku..English: We don't have anything for ye, old man.

Čomu v tvojej družine bola potvora?.English: Why did you have a cursed beast among your colleagues?

Čo ste tu v kraji porábali?.English: What were ye doing in these parts?

Kto stojí za distribúciou qahwahu?.English: Who is behind the distribution of qahwah?

Čo v starom hrade robil Turek?.English: What was the Turk doing in the old castle?

Kto je Ahriman? A Zurvan?.English: Tell us of Ahriman and Zurvan.

Vyvolávačka Pauli?.English: And what of the conjuress Pauli?

Zaútočme na nich cez tajnú chodbu!.English: Attack them through their secret passage!

Pôjdeme Ignácovi dať Bohdanovu... tetova.English: We shall journey to Ignác to present Bohdan's... 'tattoo'.

Nič vlastne, odporúčam sa..English: Very well, I shall take my leave then.

Nakŕm sliepku temným zrnom..English: Offer the hen the dark bean.

Dopraj sebe poriadne (daj mu fľašku)..English: Enjoy it heartily (hand him a bottle).

Dukaty neobanujem..English: I will not scorn your coins.

Ľen neznam, jak do staryho hradu sa dost.English: I know not what way leads to yon old castle.

Hej, lem mi ho pripomeň..English: Yes, just remind me of it.

Uhni, ľen idzem pozrec, či vinko dobre t.English: Step aside, I just want to inquire whether wine is stored here.

Čo je toto za miesto?.English: What sort of place is this?

O židovi podiškurujme..English: Let us discourse regarding the Jew.

Tu aha, delobuch šak mame..English: Here, see this, petard. I'll set it up there.

Pekne tu buď, dosť už si krk nastavovala.English: Stay here nicely. Ye hast risked ye neck enough.

Dobre skús, to..English: Well, give it a try, then.

Idzeš na dereš, moj zlaty..English: Off to the rack with ye.

Ako si naviazaný na kult?.English: How art thou bound to the cult?

Prečo si v krčme rýmoval?.English: Why were thee rhyming in the tavern?

Kto bol ten Turek, čo sa udusil?.English: Who was that Turk who choked?

Co chce toten vaš kult dosahnuc vlastne..English: What is the aim of ye cult, in truth?

To ty si ten koreň?.English: Art ye the mastermind behind it all, Root?

Toten Bohdan jak vypatra?.English: And what features dost this Bohdan posses?

Skadzik mace peňeži na taku vilku?.English: Whence dost ye gather such riches for ye estate?

To je sice pekne ale vobec ma to nezajim.English: 'Tis a noble deed, but it concerns me naught.

Skadzi mam znac, dze suchare skryvaš?.English: How am I to discern the whereabouts of ye biscuits?

Máš pravdu, poďme spať....English: You are right, let's go sleep.

Jakto, že na tvoj hrad Husiti neútočia?.English: How come Hussites don't attack yer castle.
